item.title: Diplomacy | Thailand agrees in principle with ceasefire with Cambodia
item.description:
Thailand's interim prime minister Phumtham Wechayachai said yesterday that the country agreed, in principle, with a ceasefire, but emphasized the need for “sincere intentions” by Cambodia
According to Thai Foreign Ministry, Phumtham WeChayachai called on rapid bilateral negotiations to discuss concrete measures towards a peaceful conflict resolution. The current government leader also thanked the president of the United States, with whom he spoke hours earlier, in a telephone conversation where Donald Trump presented a ceasefire proposal. Also Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet said yesterday that the country accepted negotiations for an "immediate and unconditional ceasefire." "This is good news for soldiers and people from both countries," said Cambodian leader in a statement. Manet instructed Foreign Minister Prak Sokhonn to start discussions with US counterpart Marco Rubio to end the conflict that broke out on Thursday. Still, journalists from the France-Presse news agency in Samraong, Cambodia, about 20 kilometers from the Thailand border, heard the sound of artillery shots at dawn. A spokeswoman for the Cambodia Ministry of Defense also stated that Thailand had attacked at 4:50 am (05h50 in Macao) near two temples whose sovereignty is disputed by the two countries. Colonel Richa Suksowanont, the Thai army deputy spokesman, accused Cambodian forces of shooting yesterday morning heavy artillery against Surin's province, including civilian houses. Richa Suksowanont said Cambodia also launched rocket attacks against the former Ta Muen Thom temple, claimed by both countries, and other areas, in an attempt to recover the protected territory by Thai troops. The Thai forces responded with long-range artillery to reach the artillery and the Cambojan launches. Battlefield operations will continue and a ceasefire can only happen if Cambodia formally starts negotiations, Richa Suksowanont added. On the other side Cambodian Ministry of Defense spokesman, Lieutenant General Maly Socheata, accused Thai forces of intensifying violence with bombing in Cambodian territory on Sunday morning, followed by a “large-scale foray” involving land tanks and troops in various areas. "Such actions undermine all efforts to a peaceful resolution and expose Thailand's clear intention to intensify the conflict rather than appease it," he said. A historic border dispute between the two countries led on Thursday to clashes that involved fighters, tanks, land troops and artillery. The fighting caused 33 deaths and more than 130,000 displaced on both sides of the border. The balance already exceeds the previous series of major border clashes between the two countries, which caused 28 deaths between 2008 and 2011. The UN Security Council met in urgent and, on Saturday, the United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres, condemned the escalation of violence between Thailand and Cambodia, asked both parties who commit to a ceasefire and offered as a mediator.

item.title: Tourism | Government highlights the good numbers of the first semester
item.description: The secretary's office for the economy and finances highlighted yesterday the figures recorded by the tourism sector in the first half, namely the more than 19 million tourists who visited Macau. This is “an increase of 15 percent in annual terms and a recovery to about 95 percent of the amounts recorded in the same period of 2019”. The executive also points out that "the number of international visitors reached 1.34 million, an increase of almost 15 percent in annual terms." The numbers were explained by the “full use of Macao's own advantages in conjunction with the central government's support policies and the efforts of all sectors of society,” proving a “positive trend” of “tourism industry development”.

item.title: Almost 5,600 residents of Macao found a job in Hengqin
item.description: In April, 5,592 residents of Macao were employees in the deepened cooperation zone in Hengqin, a total of growth and 32.2 percent compared to last year. The data are part of a jointly conducted hengqin representation of the Macao Women's Association and the Institute for Research and Development of the in -depth cooperation zone, quoted by the newspaper or Mun on Saturday. According to the data presented, in April this year, 27,629 residents of Macau lived or worked in the deepened cooperation zone, which represented an increase of 27.6 percent, compared to April 2024. Among them, the number of people living on Mountain Island totaled 23,106 (plus 11.5 percent to 2024). The study conducted by the Association, which has been one of the groups advocating the policy to support the in -depth cooperation zone. It also shows that more than 80 percent of residents living or working in Hengqin are “satisfied” with life on the other side of the border. Based on about 500 questionnaires, 80 percent of respondents showed satisfaction with “entrepreneurship” and “the employment environment” in the in -depth cooperation zone. Here and there When asked by the fact that most contributes to moving to Hengqin, 89.31 percent of respondents highlighted the “beautiful atmosphere” of Mountain Island. The Chinese language publication points only some of the factors studied, and much if it does not indicate the percentage of answers. However, the most criticized aspect of respondents was the lack of infrastructure on the other side of the border and the lack of other facilities. Among the main criticisms of people living or working in Hengqin also arise the difficulties of transporting certain Macau products from Macau to Hengqin and vice versa due to customs rules. As part of the conclusions, the survey of various restrictions on the circulation between the two territories and the access of residents in Hengiqn to areas such as health, social security and education is advocated.

item.title: Judicial Police | Child falls from window when he was alone
item.description:
Authorities indicted the mother and maid of the crime of abandonment, punishable by prison sentence that could reach eight years. The child was alone at home, while the maid went to pick up his brother from school
The Judicial Police (PJ) indicated the mother and maid of the crime of abandonment, after a child fell from a window when he was alone at home. The case took place on July 15, but the information about the investigation was revealed on Friday by PJ, according to the newspaper or Mun. The case was discovered around 1 pm, when the boy was found on the floor of Gamboa Street, after falling from a four -story building. The victim of the fall was taken to the hospital, where he was diagnosed with an intra-cranial hemorrhage, being hospitalized. Until yesterday, the authorities did not reveal whether the male child was at risk of life. Given the possibility of having a crime, the PJ agents investigated the fall and found that on the morning of the accident both the parents and the child's brother had left home. The child stood to keep a maid, who was also responsible for fetching the victim's older brother from school. When she fetched her brother, the maid left the boy alone at home with a tablet and locked the housing door. The minor's mother was informed about the conditions in which the child had been left. However, the PJ says it concluded that when the child was alone at home began to cry and scared. The victim also tried to use tools to open the door. However, as it could not open the door, the authorities believe that the child tried to get out of housing through the kitchen window, which led to the fall. Authorities also found that this was not the first time the boy has been home alone, which would have happened more often since June 17. The child's injuries were considered consistent with a fall in height. The case was delivered to the prosecutor and the mother and worker are indicted for the crime of abandonment, punished with a sentence of one to five years in prison, which in this case may be aggravated to eight years in prison, if it is considered that the injuries are serious offense to physical integrity. Accompanying After the investigation was made public, Hon Wai, president of the Institute of Social Action, said the family is being accompanied and that is "deeply sad", according to the Macao channel of TDM. "Unfortunately, I believe everyone knows this unfortunate incident. The family is deeply sad and IAS is providing direct assistance to the family," he said. "We need to work hard with this family, how to deal with the future and the care of children," he acknowledged. According to the or world, the president of IAS also called on families to avoid leaving children alone at home, even if it is for a short time, because there are always "risks" in these situations. Hon Wai thus asked families to try better coordination to accompany children and involve more members in the surveillance of minors.

item.title: Chikungunya | New cases lead to the suspension of blood donations
item.description:
Due to imported cases of chikungunya fever, health services will ban infected, or people suspected of being infected, donating blood for six weeks
Health services announced the record of two more imported cases of chikungunya fever on Friday, which raises the number of cases for four, and announced new control measures. With the announced changes, who has been infected with chikungunya or that has symptoms of fever should suspend blood donations. The new measures were taken "taking into account the occurrence of cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever recorded in Macao and neighboring regions, and the prevention of the risk of disease transmission through blood." With the changes, there are two types of people who are unable to donate blood for six weeks: residents diagnosed with chikungunya fever and residents who were in an epidemic area two weeks before they donated blood and have symptoms such as fever, intense joint pain, headache, nausea, fatigue and stress. In the case of people with symptoms such as fever, intense joint pain or muscles, headache, nausea, fatigue and rash over the past 14 days, but have not been in epidemic zones, the blood transfusions center will make an assessment of a case-a-pellet. Summer Diseases Regarding new cases of chikungunya fever, the first was identified in a 48-year-old non-resident worker who works on Kwong Tung Avenue and lives in Gonçalo Beco, near Avenida Almeida Ribeiro. The man was diagnosed on Friday, after being in the Philippines between July 6 and July 19, to visit the family. After returning it began to experience muscle pain and fever. He moved to Kiang Wu hospital on Thursday and was diagnosed the next day. House and work colleagues, like the family, have no symptoms of the infection. The second case was registered in a 38 -year -old resident. The man lives in Seac Pai Van, in the butterfly valley and works on one of the Cotai casinos. The man was diagnosed after being in the city of Foshan, between July 19 and 20. After returning to Macao, he had leg pain and fever. It was diagnosed on Friday at the Conde São Januário Hospital Center. Both patients are far from danger and in stable conditions. In response to the two imported cases, health services were in the zones indicated to take mosquito extermination measures. "Health services recall residents that they must be aware of prevention measures and that they must take action, so that a barrier against mosquito infectious diseases are built," he was appealed in a statement. According to health services chikungunya fever is a viral disease, transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes, especially those of Aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus.

item.title: Macau Bridge | Ron Lam questions closure during sign 8 of typhoon
item.description:
The still legislator asked the executive to reveal the results of the tests done on the bridge during the passage of the Wipha Typhoon and to indicate if a decision on the opening of the Macau bridge to traffic on the days when the Typhoon signal 8 is lifted.
Deputy Ron Lam intends that the government explain the reasons for the Macau Bridge to have been closed during the Wipha Typhoon pass, when Typhoon's sign 8 was lifted. The subject is addressed through written interpellation, in which the legislator cites the bridge builder that ensures that the infrastructure is prepared to remain open during signal 8. In the document, the deputy makes a temporal description of the events and hours when the different signs of typhoon were lifted. In this line of reasoning, Lam reports that after signal 10 was directly reduced to 8, at 5 pm on Sunday, several facilities began to gradually open, such as the different borders, and that traffic was circular again. However, Lam criticizes the fact that the Macao bridge was closed leading to large congestion on the bottom board Sai Van, the only way to cross between Macao and the mud. The question was previously answered by the Executive, who indicated that he ended the bridge to test the wind speed, including the installation of meters, since this was the first time signal 8 has been lifted since the opening of the infrastructure. Ron Lam recognized the executive's position. However, it requires other clarifications, because when the construction of the bridge was approved one of the main arguments was the possibility of another connection between Macao and the mud during Typhoon days. Other expectations The deputy also explains that when the bill was launched that the public works portal indicated that the bridge would be opening during the passage of tuffons. In addition, Lam recalls that the infrastructure builder [China Civil Engineering Construction Company in Hong Kong and Macau] made statements to say that tests had been made that showed that the wind speed was reduced by 33.4 percent and that the bridge would be closed with signal number 9, but would be opened with signal number 8. "If the bridge was designed and built rigorously and following the demands of the public tender, and if the acceptance of the work was performed according to the standards required, then it has to be prepared to be open to circulation when the number 8 of Typhoon is lifted," writes Lam. "Why was the bridge closed to traffic, and the authorities did not report the population that would be closed about wind speed?" questions. "Were the construction of last year of the construction company were done following standards that do not comply with minimum requirements or were there other reasons that led to the need to perform more tests?" The legislator also intends to explain whether the tests have been completed, what the results and when it will be announced if the bridge will be opened during the storm signal 8. Cost of 5.2 billion The Macau bridge is 3.085 kilometers long, of which 2.9 kilometers are above sea level. The structure consists of two 280 meters long maritime navigation spans. The work has eight traffic roads in both directions, with two of the lanes to serve exclusively motorcycles. The bridge board also has spaces for the installation of pipes, such as high voltage electric cables, fuel gas conducts, tap water pipes, recycled water and water for firefighters, among others. The final cost of the infrastructure has not yet been publicly announced, but the initial budget was 5.2 billion patacas.

item.title: Elections | Residents ask for transparency in the exclusion of candidates
item.description:
Some residents admit that deputies should love China and Macau, but question the fact that 12 candidates for the Legislative Assembly have been excluded without the reasons.
A tour guide, a student, a renovated and an unemployed listened to Lusa question the reason for the exclusion of 12 candidates for the Macao Parliament and ask for more electoral transparency. “Disqualification without justification”. This is how it reacts Elory Kuong, a 25 -year -old tour guide, to the recent exclusion of 12 candidates for the Legislative Assembly (AL). Kuong is one of the few people Lusa deals with in the city center and is available to talk about the latest episode of electoral disqualification. “All this is opaque,” says the young man. The State Security Defense Commission (CDSE) excluded last week the candidates of two lists to the elections of September 14, considering them “not defenders of the basic or non-faithful law to the Special Administrative Region of Macao da Popular Republic of China” In a statement, CDSE explained that when a candidate is disqualified for lack of patriotism, all the others in the same line are removed. “I don't know who I can vote for or who can represent me,” admits Kuong. Unlike the tour guide, Elexa Kam, 30, and currently in unemployment, goes to the ballot box “by duty”, although he has not yet decided to trust the vote. He spoke to Lusa in Tap Seac Square, the heart of the city, and also she questions the transparency of the system: "We don't know why they were disqualified, I think the government should be more transparent. Citizens have the right to know." Confidential documents When he announced the exclusion of the 12 candidates, the president of the Electoral Commission, Seng Ioi Man, assured journalists that the binding opinions of the CDSE, of which it is not possible to appeal, "have a clear and sufficient legal foundation" and were elaborated "taking into account the facts." However, he refused to reveal the facts that led to exclusion, arguing that “the works and documents” of CDSE “are confidential”. “Why were so many people disqualified? They have not obstructed the work of Macau,” assumes 69 -year -old renovated Wong Yat Hung who is not census. “The system should be fairer,” he says. Exclusion covers six candidates from the Popular Liveliod Force List in Macao, led by social worker Alberto Wong. The other list that was left out is the power of synergy, the current deputy Ron Lam U Tou, one of the most critical voices of Parliament. Al “lost the most liberal and pluralistic character after disqualifications,” says an 18 -year -old student of a nickname Pun. “It's a pity that this unique dynamic is now missing,” he laments. Like the other interviewees, Pun also expresses frustration with the system: "If they [government] decide that you should not be there, no matter what you do, you will be disqualified anyway." Nonetheless, the student admits to support and electoral law and the decision of the Electoral Commission. "It is not a situation that can control, I am not a politician, there is no way to fix it," he says. Following the announcement of the exclusion of the candidates, the Government of the region demonstrated, in a statement, "strong support" to the decision of the CDSE, which described as "a correct measure for the full application of the fundamental principle" Macao governed by patriots ". What is patriotism? To Lusa, Pun also argues that deputies must "love the country, love Macau and love people", although admitting not being able to explain the term "patriotism." And it's not the only one. “I can't define,” says Elory Kuong. Joe Chan Chon Meng, from Ron Lam's list and one of the 12 candidates excluded from the parliamentary race for lack of patriotism, told Lusa last week that the whole team "Ama Macao and loves China." Joe Chan, environmentalist and educator, noted that the only reason he can find for disqualification is that sometimes he “talks against them,” referring to the Macao authorities. This is the second time that candidates for direct suffrage are excluded in the race to AL, after, in 2021, the commission disqualified five lists and 21 candidates-15 of which pro-democracy. With this year's ruling, six lists compete for direct suffrage, eight less than in 2021. Thirty -three deputies are part of AL, 14 of which are elected by direct suffrage, 12 for indirect suffrage through associations, and seven are later appointed by the head of the executive government. The Electoral Law for the Legislative Assembly, in force since April 2024, states that "those who publicly incite voters not to vote, vote in blank or null, are punished with prison up to three years."

item.title: Exhibition | The Camões de Vítor Hugo Marreiros in Lisbon
item.description:
The first individual exhibition of Vítor Hugo Marreiros in Lisbon was inaugurated on Saturday, at the Galeria Passavite. The show brings together portraits of Luís de Camões taken from the posters that the designer and artist Macanese has been doing for decades to celebrate June 10. The inspiration, about this and other figures from Portugal and its literature, is far from exhausting
“Camões, five zero zero” is the exhibition that can be seen until the end of August at the Passavite Gallery in Lisbon, and the first in the individual name of the artist and designer Macanese Vítor Hugo Marreiros. This is not the first total premiere of martyrs on Portuguese soil, taking into account their previous participation in collective exhibitions, but it is the first time it exposes in their own name and soon to show a job that so much visibility has given him in recent times: the June 10 posters with the face of Camões, and not only. The show “Camões, five zero zero” is, as the name implies, an exhibition dedicated entirely to the poet's images in these posters, but with a new outfit and artistic language. “Everything came from the challenge proposed by a colleague of mine, Henrique Silva, better known as bibn,” he told HM. "The paintings that are here are not only taken from the posters of June 10, but also from other works, because throughout my professional life I had numerous opportunities to portray Portuguese themes and icons such as Fernando Pessoa, Amália, even Sardinha," he said. Vítor Hugo Marreiros makes the posters of June 10 - Camões Day, Portugal and the Portuguese communities for 34 years and has always sought to merge the figure of the poet with some themes of the current of the country, as well as the symbols of Portuguese. "In recent years I have tried to portray the concerns of the Portuguese community [of Macau], as well as events in Portugal, the crisis, covid-19 or the war in Ukraine. Camões speaks for themselves, in different years and always accompanied by the events of the year. I sometimes put Camões talking for me. My companion always tells me, that I put Camões to say what I want." There have been times, and posters, in which the artist portrayed some episodes of Macao's current, such as increasing the installation of video surveillance chambers or even the ban on smoking in certain sites. "I felt that, within the Portuguese community and all of Macau, this episode [the prohibition of smoking] had been like an aggression. Sometimes I hear the concerns of the community and also mine, not only in relation to Portugal, but also to Macau. item.title: Telegram | Thousands of men shared intimate photos of women
item.description: Thousands of men in China shared pictures and intimate videos of their girlfriends or wives, without their consent, in applying Telegram messages, which generated a general appeal to reinforce women's protection. The wave of reactions occurred after a Chinese student was expelled from a university in mid-July for “violation of national dignity” after an e-sport's Ukrainian player released videos on Telegram, showing that they had intimate relationships. A similar event took place on Thursday. A Chinese discovered that photos of her, taken without her knowledge, were shared in a forum of this same messaging with over 100,000 users, especially Chinese men, revealed Southern Daily, a state of state communication. “We are not content that can be discharged, viewed and randomly fantasized,” one can read in a comment on the Red Note social network. “We can no longer remain silent.” Because next time, I can be me, or be you, ”he adds. Pornography is illegal in China and conservative behaviors in relation to women remain the norm, reinforced by state media and popular culture. The largest group of this type on Telegram, called “Mask Park”, has been removed since, but smaller groups derived from this remain active, according to the woman contacted by Southern Daily. Other forum members also shared photos of their current or old companions, according to an article published in the Guangming Daily, a medium of communist communisting Chinese in power, raising a general shock on the Internet. A hashtag associated with this case has been consulted more than 230 million times on the Weibo social platform since Thursday. Chinese authorities have not yet announced any measures against Telegram, which is forbidden in China, but is still accessible through some virtual private networks, the platform told AFP news agency.

item.title: Water | Two more brands fail security tests
item.description: The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) has announced that two waters produced outside Macau spoiled safety and quality tests. In a statement issued only in Chinese language, on Friday, AMI identified brands such as the “natural drinking water in the village of Chang Ming Shui”, originating in Zhongshan, and the Australian “PH8 Natural Alkaline Spring Water”. According to AMI, 42 water brands produced abroad from Macau for sale in local supermarkets were tested by collecting 240 samples, resulting in 48 tested products. As a result of these exams, AMI indicated that the two identified waters did not pass the tests and that the lots in question were removed from circulation. He was also appealed to residents who discharged themselves and do not consume them. In the case of the brand “Natural Drinking Water of Chang Ming Shui Village” is at stake for an 18.9 -liter bottle of bottles, with production date of 23 May. AMI found that water has levels of coliform bacteria that do not respect the recommended standards. The coliforms are a type of bacteria, such as E.Coli, which inhabit the gut of mammals. In the case of PH8 Natural Alkaline Spring Water, tests showed levels of pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria that do not respect the recommended values. Pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria can be found in waters and soils and can lead to severe infections in the lungs, skin or urinary tract. Problem products are 1.5 liter bottles that are part of the batch identified as “B/B 09/05/26 pkd09/05/24 b.09”.

item.title: Today Macau
item.description:
Thailand's interim prime minister Phumtham Wechayachai said yesterday that the country agreed, in principle, with a ceasefire, but emphasized the need for “sincere intentions” by Cambodia
According to Thai Foreign Ministry, Phumtham WeChayachai called on rapid bilateral negotiations to discuss concrete measures towards a peaceful conflict resolution. The current government leader also thanked the president of the United States, with whom he spoke hours earlier, in a telephone conversation where Donald Trump presented a ceasefire proposal. Also Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet said yesterday that the country accepted negotiations for an "immediate and unconditional ceasefire." "This is good news for soldiers and people from both countries," said Cambodian leader in a statement. Manet instructed Foreign Minister Prak Sokhonn to start discussions with US counterpart Marco Rubio to end the conflict that broke out on Thursday. Still, journalists from the France-Presse news agency in Samraong, Cambodia, about 20 kilometers from the Thailand border, heard the sound of artillery shots at dawn. A spokeswoman for the Cambodia Ministry of Defense also stated that Thailand had attacked at 4:50 am (05h50 in Macao) near two temples whose sovereignty is disputed by the two countries. Colonel Richa Suksowanont, the Thai army deputy spokesman, accused Cambodian forces of shooting yesterday morning heavy artillery against Surin's province, including civilian houses. Richa Suksowanont said Cambodia also launched rocket attacks against the former Ta Muen Thom temple, claimed by both countries, and other areas, in an attempt to recover the protected territory by Thai troops. The Thai forces responded with long-range artillery to reach the artillery and the Cambojan launches. Battlefield operations will continue and a ceasefire can only happen if Cambodia formally starts negotiations, Richa Suksowanont added. On the other side Cambodian Ministry of Defense spokesman, Lieutenant General Maly Socheata, accused Thai forces of intensifying violence with bombing in Cambodian territory on Sunday morning, followed by a “large-scale foray” involving land tanks and troops in various areas. "Such actions undermine all efforts to a peaceful resolution and expose Thailand's clear intention to intensify the conflict rather than appease it," he said. A historic border dispute between the two countries led on Thursday to clashes that involved fighters, tanks, land troops and artillery. The fighting caused 33 deaths and more than 130,000 displaced on both sides of the border. The balance already exceeds the previous series of major border clashes between the two countries, which caused 28 deaths between 2008 and 2011. The UN Security Council met in urgent and, on Saturday, the United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres, condemned the escalation of violence between Thailand and Cambodia, asked both parties who commit to a ceasefire and offered as a mediator.

This will be either a place elected by immortals, or some supreme view of the world of mortals. Admiring the mountainous chain, Gao extends doubt to his own representation, wrapped in clouds and fogs, where the mountains would be endowed with a lightness that would soon make them loose and fly. These heavy and light mountains at the same time were a threshold, a conducive place for meetings from the most unlikely to the most certain friendship. It was one of those less amazing but no less stunning meetings that was registered by painter Zhu Ling (C.1635-C.1680) in the backing vessel to the spring mountains, in the shape of a folding range (paint and color on paper, 18 x 50.5 cm, in the Kaikodo collection, Hawai). I will try to deliver it to this man from the sound mountains, that will arrive at this time to meet And then it will return. » It can be imagined that this mountain inhabitant, who once a year goes down for a date, be someone like his close friend Wan Shouqi (1603-1652) who, two years after the fall of the Ming, becomes a monk and withdrawn only to the brush arts. And that sometimes illustrated from Doistists on the border of credibility, such as Fei Changfang, possessing a baton that allowed him to travel unbelievable distances. Zhu Ling not only followed in his paintings the characteristic style of Huang Gongwang (1269-1354), the master author of the Fuchun mountain roll, with the accumulation of small separate traces cun, 'wrinkles', to describe the shapes of the mountains, such as his alternative name (zi) derives from his phrase. Adopted by a rich family, in a child, he would have exclaimed at the time: Huang Gongwang Zi Jiu, "Mr. Huang had long wanted to have a child," whose first part Huang Gongwang would be adopted as his name, and the last Zijiu as his alternative name. Zhu Ling took two characters from this sentence, Wangzi to be his alternative name. item.title: Dengue Fever | Authorities warn of the risk of imported cases
item.description:
Macau is facing a “high risk” period of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya. The warning was reiterated yesterday at a joint conference on health services and the institute for municipal affairs. Last year's dengue fever cases have been the highest of the last two decades
Health Services (SS) and the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) joined yesterday to alert the population to the growing risk of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever, given that the summer period is synonymous with more travel and travel. At a press conference, Leong Iek Hou, doctor and head of the SS disease prevention and control center, said that "there was an increase in cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever in neighboring regions, which is a high risk to Macao." In addition, he added, "we know that we are in the summer time, there is an increase in the number of Macao residents who travel abroad, or tourists traveling to Macao, factors that may increase the risk of disease." Thus, “the risk of cases [fever] in Macau is high,” said the official. Leong Iek Hams advanced some numbers, having said that until Sunday, 2,285 confirmed fever cases were reported, 2,100 occurred only in Shunde district. In the case of Macao, between 2013 and 2019 there were “two to three imported cases of chikungunya fever, all from Southeast Asia”, but in recent years it has increased, although there are no serious cases. Leong Iek Hou also highlighted the fact that, last Friday, Macau registered the first imported case of this year's Chikungunya fever. According to a statement issued by the SS that same day, the patient is a 61 -year -old man, resident and resident in the Cheng I building, on Avenida do Conselheiro Borja. Between July 8 and 17, the patient moved to Shunde district in Foshan, with the aim of visiting family members. However, they describe the SS, on the morning of the 17th “began to present symptoms such as fever, headaches, muscle and joint aches, among others”, having returned Macao and sought medical treatment at the Conde de São Januário hospital center. On the 18th, the public health laboratory confirmed the presence of the Chikungunya virus, with a positive result. To date, the patient has kept stable. Since the beginning of the year and until July 19, the city of Foshan recorded a total of 1,873 confirmed cases of chikungunya fever, of which 1,790 are from Shunde district, focusing mainly on the villages of Lecong, Beijiao, Chenncun. 49 cases occurred in the district of Chancheng, focusing mainly on the sub-district of Shiwanzhen, Zumiao and Zhangcha; While 34 cases were detected in the Nanhai district, focusing mainly on the Guicheng sub-district. A dengue of the worst As for dengue fever cases, Leong Iek Hama pointed out that by 2024 the occurrence of this disease "it was relatively more severe when compared to the last 20 years, as 38 cases of dengue were recorded, nine locations." "This year were registered eight cases imported of dengue fever, being a place," said the SS official. It has been said that it is possible to lock and combat these infections through, for example, the cleaning of stagnant water, which attracts the proliferation of mosquitoes. “This year we have done more work to eliminate mosquitoes with Jardim Camões,” said Fong Vai Seng, head of the AMI Environmental Hygiene and Licensing Department. "We can say that we can eliminate mosquitoes that can be carriers of the virus [causer of fevers], avoiding its transmission. In any of the forms we are at the peak of cases, and residents and tourists may be carried to the virus, so we have to be alert. We have done a series of cleaning work to avoid the source of mosquitoes proliferation, and until June [since the year] we have supervised about 7,400 spaces." It was mentioned. Inspection actions took place in 140 places that are considered “black points” with regard to the proliferation of mosquitoes, and between January and June this year, 1,220 chemical elimination actions of these insects were made. Both entities promise to work side by side in cleaning land. “AMI and SS have a mechanism for monitoring and treatment of hygiene problems in private spaces or unoccupied land. Whenever the ss find that there is danger to public health, or in case of an emergency situation, and whenever it is not possible to contact the landowners, AMI will collaborate on removing containers or zones with stagnant water that may serve as proliferation of Mosquitoes, ”was said at the press conference. Leong Iek Hou also explained that there are not yet many places in Macao where tests can be done that disapprove of the infection. "There are not many medical institutions that have this type of test available. When clinics or private hospitals want to take the test for dismissing transmissible diseases, these institutions send us blood samples and we do the tests in our public health laboratory for free for various types of fever, given that symptoms are similar." Hong Kong on Alert The risk alert of more imported cases of these two types of fever has also arrived in Hong Kong. According to the South China Morning Post newspaper on Thursday, several experts warn of the high risk of infections taking into account the outbreak registered in the city of Foshan, belonging to Guangdong province. Wong Hoi-Kei, a senior doctor and head of the Guangdong Center for Health Protection, said that "although outbreaks do not occur in popular cities among Hong Kong inhabitants, frequent trips between Guangdong and Hong Kong mean the risk of imported cases is higher." Also quoted by the same newspaper, doctor Joseph Tsang Kay-Yan, an infectious illness expert, said it is possible that Hong Kong will have imported cases that may lead to sporadic infections, and explained that the two types of fevers have similar symptoms, but with a big difference: with chikungunya fever, patients feel joint pain. Wong Hoi-Kei said that several cleaning actions are being developed to avoid proliferation of mosquitoes and to inform the population for symptoms. "We have the ability to reduce the risk of an outbreak triggered by imported cases as much as possible," Wong said. This year alone, and according to data released by SCMP, more than 220,000 cases of chikungunya fever were recorded worldwide in 14 locations, including the Taiwan and Singapore regions. The latest cases of this type of fever in Hong Kong had occurred in 2019, with only 11 patients. According to the SS, the means of transmission and measures to prevent and control chikungunya fever and dengue fever are identical, both transmitted by mosquitoes of “aedes albopictus” species, which usually reproduce in small amounts of stagnant, clean and stopped water. Given the recent passage through Macao do Typhoon Wipha, the authorities yesterday remembered the importance of cleaning these spaces. Chikungunya fever is a viral disease and has a period of incubation of three to eight days, which can vary between two and 12 days, with fever symptoms and then joint pain in body areas such as wrists, knees, ankles and fingertips. Two to three days later rashes appear. "The whole course of the disease usually lasts five to seven days, being the state of health of most patients considered light," explains the SS.

item.title: War | Historians defend a monument about Vitória against Japanese invasion
item.description:
In a year of celebration of the 80th anniversary of China's victory in the war against Japanese aggression, Macao schools were encouraged by the government to convey these historical episodes to students. In the fervor of the ephemeris, an academic defended the construction of a monument to mark the date. HM has heard historians who enhance the ideas that should be transmitted by the monument
2025 is the year in which the 80th anniversary of China's victory is celebrated in the so -called Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and anti -fascist World War, that is, when China and Hong Kong managed to escape the Japanese occupation. Macao, having Portuguese administration, and for having kept neutral during World War II, was not occupied by the Japanese, although the neutrality status was quite volatile, as historian Helena Lopes showed in the work “Neutrality and Collaboration in South China: Macau During the Second World War”. In this context, the authorities have encouraged the territory schools to remember the historical episode through various activities with a patriotic nature, while Lin Guangzhi, director of the Institute for Social and Cultural Research of the University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must in the English), argued that a monument of war in Japan with Japan should be created in Macau. HM invited two historians, experts in this historical period, to comment on what has indeed happened in these years and what main messages should be transmitted if the construction of the monument actually advances. Alfredo Gomes Dias, professor of the Lisbon Polytechnic Institute and author of the Doctoral Thesis on Macaense Diaspora in World War II and the Foundation of the Popular Republic of China, entitled “The Macaense Diaspora. Macau, Hong Kong, Shanghai (1850-1952)”, argues that the celebration of this historical period is common to several countries. "In the case of China, the end of the Japanese invasion, taking into account the violence of which it has covered, can and should be celebrated generically throughout the Chinese territory," he said. But considering that Hong Kong had an effective occupation, while Macau dealt with refugee seizures and power games between Portuguese, Chinese, English and Japanese, will make sense to have a monument on the mashes? Alfredo Gomes Dias understands that yes. “In the case of Macao, the monument gains relief if he perpetuates the memory that Chinese, Portuguese and Macanese have fought the invasion, especially on the island of Hong Kong, many of them died on the battlefield. In addition, Macau maintained the tradition of being a territory of refuge that housed Chinese and Macanese from Hong Kong.” Essentially, the researcher understands that "in any of the cities he can be erected," but in the particular case of Macao, it is important that the monument "intends to take into account the specificity of the history of Macao and the diversity of origin of its residents." Moreover, which argues that it should "preserve the memory of all who have joined side by side to oppose Japanese imperialism at this time." “Ambiguous neutrality” For Helena Lopes, a particular interest historian in Macao's landscape in World War II, and author of the work on Macao's neutrality during this period, said she did not see "no problem in building a commemorative monument of World War II in Macao." In the 1930s and 40s of the twentieth century, he recalls, "most of the population was, like today, Chinese," although "a significant number of the population was a refugee, having sought in Macao (such as in other places not occupied in China) shelter of the violence of conflict." Thus, Helena Lopes, professor of history at contemporary Asia at the University of Cardiff, in Wales, says it is "normal for China to celebrate victory in World War II, as other allied countries do." Regarding Macao's neutrality, the historian says it was "ambiguous", given that "many opposite sides intersected in the territory during the war." In these years, "the territory has been deeply linked to networks of resistance and humanitarian aid during the war: it was not isolated from conflict, but it was deeply linked to several of its dynamics identically to other territories in China under foreign dominance (such as foreign concessions of Shanghai or Hong Kong until these territories were completely occupied)." In this context, he adds Helena Lopes, "it seems natural to celebrate resistance against Japan during the war, where they participated - openly or underground - several people in Macao (Chinese and other nationalities)," he said. THE ROLE OF HISTORICAL EDUCATION Territory schools have been "encouraged" by the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) to organize sessions for students and teachers to watch the ceremonies of the "80th anniversary of the Chinese people's victory in the war against Japan and world victory against fascism." According to a press conference organized to announce these initiatives, the celebrations of the 80th anniversary of victory against the Japanese start on September 3 in Beijing, and DSEDJ intends to organize various events in Macao. Asked about the inclusion of historical celebrations, with a patriotic nature, in local schools, Helena Lopes says “she has no elements to comment on the educational situation in Macao currently”, recalling that in the years of World War II, “schools in Macau were themselves spaces of refuge and resistance to Japanese occupation of China”. In turn, Alfredo Gomes Dias stresses that “historical education is always an extension of the narrative of national history”, “a reality common to all countries” and not exclusive to Macao. The DSEDJ press conference for the presentation of commemorative events was attended by the secretary for social and culture affairs, Lam, which has the Pelouro da Education. The ruler said last June that the government's goal is to "promote the great spirit of the War of Resistance" and "inspire patriotic fervor." All activities will be subordinate to the theme: "Remember the story, stroking the memory of the martyrs, caressing peace and creating the future." One of the highlights of the celebrations will be the memory of the victims of the Nanjing massacre, a celebration scheduled for December 13. Nanjing's massacre took place in 1937, having stepped for a few weeks after the conquest by the Japanese troops of the one who was the capital of the Republic of China. After the conquest, the Japanese troops massacred the population, including children, women and not combatants. The invasion of China through Japan began in 1931 with the occupation of Manchuria at first. In 1937, Japan expanded the scope of war, seeking the total occupation of China. What began as a conflict located in Asia would eventually be integrated in World War II, from December 1941, with the attacks of Pearl Harbor. Over the course of several years, estimates point out that on the Chinese side between 3.8 million and 10.6 million people died. Peace was reached on December 2, after the United States attacked Japan with the second atomic bomb in Nagasaki. HM sent questions to Lin Guangzhi, author of the idea of building a monument, but until the closing of this edition was not obtained.

item.title: Wipha | Macau reached the maximum signal 10 and only lowered to 3 at night

Typhoon Wipha's passage through Macao forced the authorities to take sign 10, and a total of 163 occurrences were registered, highlighting, highlighting five people who were injured and had to receive medical treatment. Sign 3 of storm was only lifted last night
Typhoon Wipha passed yesterday by Macau without leaving havoc of larger, although he has obliged the authorities of the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) to keep the 10th of storm, the maximum in this type of occurrences, for many hours, between 12:30 and 17h, when it was passed to signal 8. At the time of the closing of this edition, the probability of the tropical signal 3 Between 21h and 23h, synonymous with permission to resume the activities of daily life. Sign 3 was really lifted at 10:30 pm on Sunday. At 20h was still the blue sign of “Storm Surge”, with expectations of flooding in the low areas of the city between 4am and 8am this Monday. According to official data, until 7 pm on Sunday the Civil Protection Operations Center recorded 163 occurrences on both the Macao Peninsula and the islands, especially the registration of five typical injuries, which received hospital treatment in both public health facilities and the Kiang Wu Hospital. Only one person will have been retained in the elevator during the passage of the tropical storm. It is also mentioned the registration of 54 cases in which authorities had to remove broken lamps, falling trees or overthrowing, or construction infrastructure with potential risk. There were also 98 cases of plaster removal, advertising panels, windows or awnings, as well as seven cases where scaffolding or other facilities was required at work-attest, or even overthrown. item.title: Macao Forum | Former advisor to Rocha Vieira enhances complementarity
item.description:
The role of the Macao Forum should be compromised in a complementary way to other existing cooperation. The idea was defended by Tiago Vasconcelos, advisor to Rocha Vieira, at a symposium promoted by the City of Macau. The Major General also agrees with the extent of the forum to Spanish-speaking countries
On Tuesday at the City of Macau (UCM), a symposium centered on cooperation in areas of scientific research and higher education between Macau, China and Portuguese-speaking countries, which served to present various academic projects that are being developed at MSAR. The event was attended by Major-General Tiago Vasconcelos, who was an advisor to General Rocha Vieira in the last years of the Portuguese administration of the territory, and who defended a broader look at the role that the Macao Forum can take. In its presentation, which HM had access, it is read that "the importance of the creation of the Macau Forum cannot be underestimated, both from a symbolic and practical point of view," but "it is necessary to be realistic as to what one can expected from such an organization." Thus, for Tiago Vasconcelos, “the Macao Forum must find its place among other forms of diplomacy”, such as “bilateral relations, in some cases 'strategic partnerships' bilateral, such as Brazil and Portugal”, or “belonging to other forums” or “multilateral organizations such as G20 or BRICS, of which both China and Brazil are members, or the ASEAN Regional Forum, of which Timor-Leste as China are participants. ” It is for the person responsible for a "variable geometry", where "the belongings of countries to various forums simultaneously can offer opportunities for the" Macao Platform "to broaden its scope." And here the former advisor of the last Portuguese governor of Macau highlights the importance of the extent of the MSA platform to Spanish -speaking countries, something that has also been defended by the local executive. Thus, the MSAR can, with the multiplicity of roles and partnerships of the Macao Forum, “reach other Latin-speaking countries, especially Spanish-speaking, given the similarities between Portuguese and Spanish languages, and existing dialogue platforms, such as the Ibero-American conference, which connects Portugal, Spain and most Latin American countries”. In general terms, the official understands that one should “understand the proper role played by the Macau Forum among the various personalized bilateral and multilateral cooperation formats, as well as the lessons learned from the more than 20 years of history of the Forum”. This “is of paramount importance to ensure the proper level of ambition and the effectiveness of any new forms of cooperation in which Macau can act as a useful platform,” he said. A promising land In conclusion, Tiago Vasconcelos said that since the arrival of the early Portuguese to the territory, in the mid -16th century, that "Macao has played a traditional role as a platform between mainland China and the outside world", playing "part of the" Portuguese world "for almost 450 years, naturally integrating its network." Thus, ties with Portuguese -speaking countries are "a legacy of their history," which "helps Macao to preserve some of their distinctive characteristics, but also play a useful role in supporting Chinese diplomacy, further facilitating China's relations with Portuguese -speaking countries." For Tiago Vasconcelos, “Macau's prospects are quite promising to continue to play its traditional and very distinctive role as a connecting platform between China and the Portuguese-speaking countries”, taking into account that it begins half of the 50-year transition period present in the Sino-Portuguese joint statement of 1987. Still in the area of higher education, the Major General pointed out that "despite its dimension, Macau is becoming, if it is no longer, a center of excellence for higher education in China." "Even worldwide, the same can be said about some specific sectors, making Macau a highly attractive destination for very talented students," he added. The official highlighted the role of the four key laboratories of the existing state, namely VLSI (large-scale integrated circuits) analog and mixed signal at the University of Macao (one); The Quality Research Laboratory in Chinese Medicine, between one and the University of Science and Technology of Macao; The Internet of Things Laboratory to Smart Cities, at UM; and also the laboratory for the Lunar and Planetary sciences, of Must. The seminar where Tiago Vasconcelos participated, entitled “Scientific and Technological Cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries”, also attended representatives of the central government's connection office on the Macau forum, among other academic and business personalities. According to a press release on the event sent to HM, José Paulo Esperança, vice-rector of the UCM Faculty of Economics, spoke of the importance of financing academic investigations by the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) in Portugal, highlighting “FCT's efforts to promote international cooperation and resolution of common challenges”. IP KUAI PENG, Vice-Rector of UCM and Director of the Institute of Studies of Portuguese Speaking Countries of the same educational institution, argued that Macau “should be based on cooperation with Portuguese-speaking countries”, as well as “actively expanding exchange in various areas with Spanish-speaking countries, building a deep, and sustainable cooperation ecosystem, continuing to expand the circle of international friends and international friends and draw a new plan for modernization ”in the format followed by China. In addition, the official believes that the “remains an important high-level outside opening window for the country” should continue to create “an international cooperation model in areas such as high technology, digital economy and standardization of traditional Chinese medicine, contributing to the construction of a technological power of the country and, at the same time, achieving diverse and moderate economic development”. Think-Tank to Spanish The UCM Vice Rector believes it can be created in Macau “an interregional Think Tank with the best universities in Portuguese and Spanish countries, focusing on areas such as green energy, biomedicine and digital technology, promoting transionic circulation with technological means and helping developing countries to overcome digital gap”. Among the participating researchers in the seminar, highlighting Marta Filipa Simões, from the Macao University of Science and Technology, which presented the Sino-Portuguese Cooperation Project in Fungi and Astrobiology Research. The academic suggested “the conduct of various research projects through cooperation between Macau and scientific research institutions in Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Mozambique and Portugal, in order to promote interregional scientific innovation”. Already André Antunes, from the University of São José, stressed that, currently, "Macao plays an important role as a point of contact in the network of Portuguese-speaking countries", with a very centered cooperation "in the economic area", although, he defended, "the scientific area will become in a new strong point."

item.title: Sao Tome and Prince | Relationship with China is discreet, but strategic
item.description:
On Saturday, 50 years of the independence of Sao Tome and Principe were celebrated. The future advances to the rhythm of diplomatic relations with other Portuguese speaking countries. For academic Cátia Miriam Costa, the African country and China are strategic partners, despite the description of the relationship between both
Researcher Cátia Miriam Costa considers that the relationship between Sao Tome and Principe and China remains discreet, despite being almost celebrating a decade, with a growing strategic interest of Beijing in the position of the archipelago in the South Atlantic. "Since neither country nor another talks much about the subject, we end up not realizing the depth of the relationship well. But I believe it is not yet a very deep relationship," the researcher at the Center for International Studies of ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, noted to Lusa. The geostrategic position of the archipelago, located in the Gulf of Guinea, feeds, however, the interest of Beijing, namely in the context of the Chinese bet on the expansion of logistics and sea corridors in the South Atlantic. "Sao Tome, if it is not a very important port in logistical terms, is a relevant port for control, for example, of piracy, threats. Therefore, this position also certainly reflected by Beijing," he explained. The restoration of formal ties in 2016, after two decades of Taiwan's recognition by Sao Tome, was a “pragmatic” decision of the African country, and a trump card for Beijing Diplomacy, which always maintained “open channels”, even during the period of removal, Cátia Miriam Costa explained. "The relationship with China is more fruitful because it brings other counterparts," explained the researcher. "It was also for these counterparts that [in 1997] Sao Tome exchanged the Popular Republic of China for Taiwan, because at that time the Popular Republic of China was a developing country. So it didn't have to offer what Taiwan had, which was perfectly integrated into the international market," he said. A VOLTE-FACE In December 2016, Sao Tome officially announced the establishment of relations with the Popular Republic of China, ending the recognition of Taiwan. The decision caused the immediate cancellation of the scholarships offered by Taiwan to St.-Tome students, many of whom were eventually integrated into the other Chinese universities. China has quickly become one of the main cooperation partners in São Tomé, with promises of investment and support in areas such as education, technical training, agriculture and infrastructure. The researcher recalled that even before formal relations, Beijing never completely broke with Sao Tome, keeping the country involved in the activities of the Macao Forum, albeit only as an observer, a strategy he considers "typical of Chinese diplomacy." "China does not fully close the doors. It can suspend relationships, but if it is something of national interest, it is usually renegotiated again," he said. “Limited Results” Nevertheless, Cátia Miriam Costa acknowledged that the concrete results of cooperation are still limited. “There are more projects in the role than properly ongoing works,” he said, attributing part of the responsibility to the weak institutional capacity of São Tomé, which only recently began to create structures to attract and negotiate foreign investment. Among the sectors with the potential for the deepening of cooperation, the researcher highlighted the fishing, the marine resources and eventually the cocoa. Oil exploration raises “high risks”, both for technical complexity and environmental limitations. "China is interested in the region, but it is not because Sao Tome is an attractive market -because it is not -yes, for its location, stability and integration capacity in a broader regional project," he said. The researcher also stressed Chinese investment in Chinese language teaching in Sao Tome, which also aims to "create a network of people with language dominance, familiar with culture and potentially useful for the future of bilateral relations." "China maintains a strategic interest in the relationship, even if it does not express it with great visibility. And for a country like Sao Tome, any small help can have a significant impact," he concluded. Reports of four Sao Tomers who followed courses in China Denise, Lucineidy, Reginaldo, and Aithysa grew up under the sign of an alliance with Taiwan, until life and academic path were redefined by the rupture of diplomatic ties between Sao Tome and Taipei in 2016. Denise Aragão Fortes still remembers her hand to Tsai Ing-Wen. It was November 2016, the day of Africa in Taiwan was celebrated, and the official was attended at the time. It is very likely that behind the scenes would already outline the end of diplomacy between Taiwan and Sao Tome and Principe, but for this student of International Relations at the University of Ming Chuan, in Taoyuan, North Taiwanese, the news, who arrived a month after these celebrations, on December 21, was a surprise. “There was no rumors, nothing,” recalls Lusa Denise, now 29, working in marketing and living in Almada, Portugal. When the secondary finished, also the bonds between the island and the African nation, agreed in 1997, had just reached the age of adult. There was “very closeness” between the parts, with Taiwanese friendships in the family. Normality shaken this December 2016. Studying with a scholarship granted by Taipei, Denise and other St.-Tome students in Taiwan was given the option of continuing studies, without financial assistance, or being transferred to China as scholarships. Being at the end of the academic course, Denise remained in Taoyuan. Most, however, changed geography, university and life. Country “full of opportunities” Lucineidy Almeida, now 28, saw the arrival in Tianjin, northern China, as "a new restart" in a "country full of opportunities." Attending the second year of biotechnology in Taichung, this native of Santo António had some difficulty in following the degree in Mandarin. A limitation that would eventually surpass, evaluates today, but in China, had the possibility of studying in English pharmaceutical sciences. He says he learned of the diplomatic break through social networks and, like all students who spoke to Lusa, left criticism of conducting the process, with “many uncertainties”, information given “on time”, “a feeling of disrespect”, and, in the middle, the suspension of the bags. Two months after the announcement, he landed in Hong Kong, where he treated his visa, although he still unaware of what his final destination. Only upon arrival in Beijing was he told that he went to Tianjin, recalls Lucineidy, living today in Portugal, in Cacém, and working as an English and Portuguese interpreter in the medical field. Regarding the diplomatic interruption, it notes that "from what was realized at the time", it was "a monetary question": "in the sense that China offered more [to Sao Tomé] than Taiwan at the time could provide." The São Tome Prime Minister of the time, Patrice Trovoada, considered the unilateral break of relations as “the right”, taking into account the authorities' view of the country's development. "We decided the principle of joining one China and when adhering implies the cut of relations with Taiwan. The international scenario 20 years ago, not the same as today," he added. But the new political order did not take students to advance in the academic career. Aithysa Ramos, 32, is still in Beijing, where, after leaving Taiwan, she concluded the master's degree in business management. If this morning of 2016, the story had not taken this course, would probably have been in Taiwan, where he had lived seven years ago. At the time, it now remembers the English education teacher, was “devastated and angry”: “It was like my second home, I passed [part of] my adolescence, growth phases”. Reginaldo was in the second year of Business Management at the University of Yuan Ze, Taoyuan, when he stayed to the news. He realized that he “had no power” to change the course of history. The initial shock, assumes today, was really the cold. Despite admitting "it was" always a process of doubts, "China, where he moved two months after the cut of relationships," it was a surprise for the better. " “Because I was still here, not coming back, I can say yes, it was the best thing that happened,” he says.

item.title: Coloane | Government canceled project of the Museum of Paladers 9 years ago
item.description:
Long before the authorities were part of the 85 square kilometers of maritime areas, there was the idea of lifting a stilts museum to consecrate this type of existing housing in Coloane. However, years later, the direction of tourism services says that the project will not even move forward, having been suspended in 2016
Between 2016 and 2017, the government planned to raise a museum about Coloane's stalps to tell the story of these peculiar houses of Macao. However, after news was published in the press to convey the inauguration of the project in 2017, the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) confirmed to HM that no museum will be born. More: not only will it not be built, but the plan was aborted nine years ago. “Due to the inclusion of the area where stilts are located in the government's urban planning plan for the coloane riverside, Lai Chi Vun shipyards and Navegantes Street, STD ended the 'Museum of the Museum of the Museum of the House' in 2016, and, subsequently, completed the 'Museum of House Project' procedure. Canceled ”, was referred to in the answer. The cancellation in 2016 is still surprising, given that on June 14 of the same year the Jornal Tribuna de Macao (JTM) reported that the inauguration of the museum would take place in 2017. In this article, statements were cited by the director of STD, Helena de Senna Fernandes, made to the newspaper or Mun, explaining that the “project was in the [conception] phase of design”. They would have been held, including “several consultations to collect opinions from the residents of that area, expecting to improve the proposal of construction”. According to JTM, the project should “be completed by the end of the year” in 2016, so that the work will be “started early 2017”, and STD expected “that the construction was completed in the same year”. After the promise, in 2018 there was still “legal fundamentals” to build the Museum in Coloane, as also reported the JTM. The justification given by the STD was that Macau has not yet had the 85 square kilometers of maritime areas under his jurisdiction, something that has been legislated, precisely, since 2018. A matter of priorities HM sought to know the state of the designer of the Museum of Palafites following the recent launch of a book on the collage of Colaane, by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the degree in Architecture of the University of São José. Now confronted with the official cancellation of the museum project, the official lamented the decision of the authorities. "The cancellation of the Museum of Slacinas project is not just news about a project that has not advanced, but a starting point to equate Macao's development priorities, the way the heritage is managed and what means for collective memory, in this case of Coloane," he said. In the opinion of the author of “The Colaane Grammar”, “The Plan for the Marginal of Rua dos Navegantes should include proposals for new buildings that use and reinterpret Madeira as the main and essential element of construction”, and the connection of this street with the Lai Chi Vun shipyards, “especially with regard to the sea front, is a unique opportunity to create a coastal corridor that celebrates Colona's seafront history”. Thus, and “given the richness of context and cancellation of the stilts museum, the focus should be on integrating the memory of these structures into the new plane”, so the existing structures of the shipyards, stilts should be restored, maintaining their original and material characteristics, but adapting them to new uses ”. Still on the patrimonial value, Filipe Afonso described, in the interview with HM, the proposal to “classify stilts as heritage to give them legal protection”. "By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection," he argued, adding that dwellings, many of them left to abandonment, "could be reused for experience tourism, or cultural interpretation centers, valuing local history." They could also “be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the waterline, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification”. Hopes Filipe Afonso highlights the process of revitalization and recovery of the Lai Chi Vun shipyard zone as a “initiative with immense historical and cultural value, which refers to the rich tradition of the region's shipbuilding”. In fact, the Lai Chi Vun shipyard zone is one of the “six zones” to recover by the government and operators, which also include places such as the pier in the interior port or Avenida Almeida Ribeiro, among others. In the area of Lai Chi Vun there is already a leisure zone where cultural initiatives have been carried out, with a museum area that tells the history of the Junos construction industry in the territory. In this sense, Filipe Afonso asks that “the Macao government does not limit the design of these projects to a restricted range of‘ short-listed companions ””, ie a restricted group of companies. Also, in his opinion, "Macau has a new generation of talented architects and creative ready to make his contribution." "I believe that through more open ideas contests, these professionals could offer innovative perspectives for the city's urban and cultural challenges. Deleting them from such crucial processes for Macao's urban and cultural development is a waste," he added. The HM contacted other architects to get reactions to the cancellation of the museum project, but did not get answers. What the law says Between the suspension of the project and today a lot has changed. In 2018, Macao arranged from the maritime management bases law, which includes 85 square kilometers of area, and whose principles provides for the environmental preservation of spaces such as those that stilts are inserted. The legislation introduced concepts such as “functional maritime zoning”, in the sense of delimiting zones “with fundamental and specific maritime functions according to location, natural resources, environmental conditions and exploration and use needs”. In the list of principles to be complied with, the legislation speaks of something like “protection of the environment of maritime areas”, in order to “protect natural resources and the environment of the sea, realizing the planning of protection and promotion of the marine ecosystem, and the marine protection should be taken into account”. It should also be “conserving the sustainability of use and development” of these areas, and their use should be done “scientifically”, according to functional maritime zoning ”. In addition to the concrete legislation that tied the paddle museum in 2016, there was also a direct planning plan to MSAR, something that was implemented in 2022 and also brings new directives for the exploration of maritime zones. Coloane now has its own UOPG-Operative Planning and Management Unit, where a “rational organization of public infrastructures and collective use equipment” should apply, as well as “appropriate use of soils” in order to create a “coordinated space structure”. Coloane's UOPG is part of the “ecological conservation zone”, which aims to “protect areas with ecological value” and “contribute to the greater protection of natural resources with ecological value”. Here it will not be allowed “to allocate soils for housing, commercial, industrial, tourist and amusement uses”, reads in the director of the masket. Coloane's UOPG is also integrated into the “green or open public spaces”, and here should be “maintaining the current use for green spaces and outdoor activities, integrating it [Coloane's UOPG] into the green zone or open public spaces”. Specifically, Coloane's UOPG should “promote the development of ecotourism and cultural tourism, with the creation of a tours of nature and the 'green and resilient waist', based on the combination of natural resources, namely hills, sea and coastal lines”. It should also “conserve and optimize existing industrial zones, build the 'waist of knowledge - industry - science' and the 'waist of cooperation of a river, two margins' and, simultaneously, rationally plan the housing zones in adequate location, according to the principle of balance between professional and residential functions”, and these points interconnect with the paradise zone, Navigantes Street and Savings Lai chi vun. item.title: AL | New Regiment prohibits deputies from disseminating content of the commissions
item.description:
With the new Hemiciclo Regiment approved yesterday, the deputies are prohibited from publicizing the subjects discussed in the meetings of the permanent committees, except for their presidents and secretaries. The subject generated debate yesterday in the Assembly regarding the limits of what may or may not be said. Pereira Coutinho voted against this article
The deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL) are now prohibited from disseminating what is discussed at the Hemiciclo Commission meetings, "anyway," with the exception of its president and secretary. These usually disclose the content of the meetings at a press conference after their holding, and this will keep up. This new regulation arises after the vote and discussion, in general and specialty, the alteration to the al. It was one of the most discussed topics in yesterday's debate, with the deputies arguing on what may or can not be said, having José Pereira Coutinho voted against this concrete article. The disclosure of information from the meetings, which serves to analyze in the specialty proposals of law and always steering at the closed door, was something that was not yet regulated. Coutinho began by asking if he could disclose the information "during the plenary meeting", for example, having said that "he never heard of any deputy who had violated that duty." "There have been meetings in the past where the secretaries warned about the information that should not be disclosed and nothing has been said. We are only 33 deputies and we should think of the possibility of revealing what was discussed, because it is difficult to define borders about what can or can not be revealed and this will give rise to many discussions later," he said. The legislator also pointed out that "it can be difficult to execute this norm" and that "the principle of transparency" should be followed. Ho Ion Sang, who presided over to the commission that analyzed the new Al Regiment, explained that "the content of the meetings is subject to the duty of confidentiality and this matter was clarified." "The content can be said by the president of the commissions after the meetings, at the press conferences, and journalists can ask questions. In practice remains as always happened and that has given good results," he said. Meet the meetings Another point addressed, whether or not the permanent committees were held at the closed door, and Pereira Coutinho defended the opening to the public like what happens in Hong Kong. The AL regiment does not prohibit open meetings, but this always depends on a prior deliberation. But iau Teng Pio, deputy, advised against the opening of the meetings. "The purpose of the closed -door meetings is so that members of the government, advisors and deputies can argue at ease even if there is no final decision. Kou Hoi In, president of AL, recalled that “the spirit of the norm has not been changed” and that everything will stay in it, only the ban on what deputies cannot refer outside the commissions. "The reserved character of permanent committees is so that everyone can speak freely and if any deputy says this or that can spoil sensations of injustice in society to deputies and this cannot happen. We have to protect deputies and ensure confidentiality." At yesterday's meeting, there was also the discussion of the duty of the deputy to participate in all permanent committees, even in those to which he does not belong. Several deputies spoke of the need for better coordination of meetings agendas. "In the future there may be more practical coordination because there are many meetings and proposals of law. We can schedule the meetings so that there are more deputies," he said. Moreover, the new Al regiment prohibits deputies by "clothing or signs, banners, signs or other objects that have offensive content or political provocation, or undermine the dignity of the AL".

In the document, the deputy makes a temporal description of the events and hours when the different signs of typhoon were lifted. In this line of reasoning, Lam reports that after signal 10 was directly reduced to 8, at 5 pm on Sunday, several facilities began to gradually open, such as the different borders, and that traffic was circular again. However, Lam criticizes the fact that the Macao bridge was closed leading to large congestion on the bottom board Sai Van, the only way to cross between Macao and the mud. The question was previously answered by the Executive, who indicated that he ended the bridge to test the wind speed, including the installation of meters, since this was the first time signal 8 has been lifted since the opening of the infrastructure. Ron Lam recognized the executive's position. However, it requires other clarifications, because when the construction of the bridge was approved one of the main arguments was the possibility of another connection between Macao and the mud during Typhoon days. Other expectations The deputy also explains that when the bill was launched that the public works portal indicated that the bridge would be opening during the passage of tuffons. In addition, Lam recalls that the infrastructure builder [China Civil Engineering Construction Company in Hong Kong and Macau] made statements to say that tests had been made that showed that the wind speed was reduced by 33.4 percent and that the bridge would be closed with signal number 9, but would be opened with signal number 8. "If the bridge was designed and built rigorously and following the demands of the public tender, and if the acceptance of the work was performed according to the standards required, then it has to be prepared to be open to circulation when the number 8 of Typhoon is lifted," writes Lam. "Why was the bridge closed to traffic, and the authorities did not inform the population that would be closed to collect information about the wind speed?" questions. "Were the construction of last year of the construction company were done following standards that do not comply with minimum requirements or were there other reasons that led to the need to perform more tests?" The legislator also intends to explain whether the tests have been completed, what the results and when it will be announced if the bridge will be opened during the storm signal 8. Cost of 5.2 billion The Macau bridge is 3.085 kilometers long, of which 2.9 kilometers are above sea level. The structure consists of two 280 meters long maritime navigation spans. The work has eight traffic roads in both directions, with two of the lanes to serve exclusively motorcycles. The bridge board also has spaces for the installation of pipes, such as high voltage electric cables, fuel gas conducts, tap water pipes, recycled water and water for firefighters, among others. The final cost of the infrastructure has not yet been publicly announced, but the initial budget was 5.2 billion patacas.
