item.title: Elections | Residents ask for transparency in the exclusion of candidates
item.description:
Some residents admit that deputies should love China and Macau, but question the fact that 12 candidates for the Legislative Assembly have been excluded without the reasons.
A tour guide, a student, a renovated and an unemployed listened by Lusa question the reason for the exclusion of 12 candidates for the Macao Parliament and ask for more electoral transparency. “Disqualification without justification”. This is how it reacts Elory Kuong, a 25 -year -old tour guide, to the recent exclusion of 12 candidates for the Legislative Assembly (AL). Kuong is one of the few people Lusa deals with in the city center and is available to talk about the latest episode of electoral disqualification. “All this is opaque,” says the young man. The State Security Defense Committee (CDSE) excluded last week the candidates of two lists of the elections of September 14, considering them “not defenders of the basic or non-faithful law to the Special Administrative Region of Macao of the Popular Republic of China” In a statement, CDSE explained that when a candidate is disqualified for lack of patriotism, all the others in the same line are removed. “I don't know who I can vote for or who can represent me,” admits Kuong. Unlike the tour guide, Elexa Kam, 30, and currently in unemployment, goes to the ballot box “by duty”, although he has not yet decided to trust the vote. He spoke to Lusa in Tap Seac Square, the heart of the city, and also she questions the transparency of the system: "We don't know why they were disqualified, I think the government should be more transparent. Citizens have the right to know." Confidential documents When he announced the exclusion of the 12 candidates, the president of the Electoral Commission, Seng Ioi Man, assured journalists that the binding opinions of the CDSE, of which it is not possible to appeal, "have a clear and sufficient legal foundation" and were elaborated "taking into account the facts." However, he refused to reveal the facts that led to exclusion, arguing that “the works and documents” of CDSE “are confidential”. “Why were so many people disqualified? They have not obstructed the work of Macau,” assumes 69 -year -old retired Wong Yat Hung who is not census. “The system should be fairer,” he says. Exclusion covers six candidates from the Popular Liveliod Force List in Macao, led by social worker Alberto Wong. The other list that was left out is the power of synergy, the current deputy Ron Lam U Tou, one of the most critical voices of Parliament. Al “lost the most liberal and pluralistic character after disqualifications,” says an 18 -year -old student of a nickname Pun. “It's a pity that this unique dynamic is now missing,” he laments. Like the other interviewees, Pun also expresses frustration with the system: "If they [government] decide that you should not be there, no matter what you do, you will be disqualified anyway." Nonetheless, the student admits to support and electoral law and the decision of the Electoral Commission. "It is not a situation that can control, I am not a politician, there is no way to fix it," he says. Following the announcement of the exclusion of the candidates, the Government of the region demonstrated, in a statement, "strong support" to the decision of the CDSE, which described as "a correct measure for the full application of the fundamental principle" Macao governed by patriots ". What is patriotism? To Lusa, Pun also argues that deputies must "love the country, love Macau and love people", although admitting not being able to explain the term "patriotism." And it's not the only one. “I can't define,” says Elory Kuong. Joe Chan Chon Meng, from Ron Lam's list and one of the 12 candidates excluded from the parliamentary race for lack of patriotism, told Lusa last week that the whole team "Ama Macao and loves China." Joe Chan, environmentalist and educator, noted that the only reason he can find for disqualification is that sometimes he “talks against them,” referring to the Macao authorities. This is the second time that candidates for direct suffrage are excluded in the race to AL, after, in 2021, the commission disqualified five lists and 21 candidates-15 of which pro-democracy. With this year's ruling, six lists compete for direct suffrage, eight less than in 2021. Thirty -three deputies are part of AL, 14 of which are elected by direct suffrage, 12 by indirect suffrage, through associations, and seven are later appointed by the head of the executive government. The Electoral Law for the Legislative Assembly, in force since April 2024, states that "those who publicly incite voters not to vote, vote in blank or null, are punished with prison up to three years."

item.title: Real Estate | Chan Iek Lap calls for seal tax reduction
item.description:
The deputy thinks that the government must follow the examples of Hong Kong and the interior of China and reduce the value of the seal tax on home purchase. Moreover, it argues that the tax should not be paid when the business is aborted
Deputy Chan Iek Lap advocates the reduction of the seal tax on real estate transactions. The subject is addressed through written interpeação, released on the Legislative Assembly portal. In the document, the deputy asks if there is an opening of the executive to lower the value of the tax seal on real estate transactions, as indicated in Hong Kong and in the interior of China: “Given the tendency to change taxes on real estate transactions in neighboring regions, and since the cities in the interior of China and also Hong Kong also indicated that the future goes through tax adjustments to reduce the charges on transactions. Will real estate agents, will the government consider the possibility of reducing tax costs for the benefit of the public? ”Asks the legislator. Currently, the seal tax on costly real estate transmissions ranges from 1 percent in transmissions with a value up to 2 million patacas, rises to 2 percent when the value of the business exceeds 2 million patacas and reaches 4 million patacas. The highest tax is 3 percent, when the value of the transfer of the property exceeds 4 million patacas. If the transmission has no costs for the parties, the tax is 5 percent. In the same vein, Chan wants to know if the executive has plans to reduce bureaucratic costs associated with real estate transactions. Since the COVID-19 pandemic and the campaign against the prosecutors of the game that the local real estate market has gone into crisis, with successive breaks of real estate and the reduction of transactions. The situation finds parallel in the interior, where the real estate market also suffered a sharp decrease. As a way of reaction to the real estate crisis, the government of Ho IAT SENG launched in 2024 a package of measures that aimed to lower taxation that focuses on residents and non-residents. Voluntary interruption In questioning, Chan Iek Lap argues that the executive must change the seal tax collection regime in cases where real estate transactions are aborted. Currently, real estate purchase and sale contracts are subject to tax payment, even if there is no transmission of the property's property right, because the parties choose to give up the business. There are also situations where the tax is paid, even later the parties have conditions that make it impossible to transmit the property. For Chan Iek Lap the tax payment in these situations is “extremely irrational”. Even in cases where it is possible to recover the amount of paid amount, when there was no transmission of the property, the deputy complains that it is necessary to face a case in the courts, and pay the costs that the action implies. In view of this scenario, the deputy intends that the government alter the legislation so that the tax is only due when the parties effectively transmit the property. At the same time, it asks for the return to the past, when 0.5 percent of the tax was paid at the time of the transaction and the rest at the time of signature of the Notarial Certificate of Purchase and Selling.

item.title: Curb | Eduardo Leal and António Leong distinguished in contest
item.description: The winners of this year's edition of the architectural photography contest promoted by Curb - Center for Architecture and Urbanism are already known. The first place was collected by Wong Chi Hin, followed by Law Heong Ieong in second place and, thirdly, Eduardo Leal, Portuguese photojournalist based in Macao. These were the winners in the “Open Group” category. Eduardo Leal also gained an honorable mention of another unlucky image, along with Wong Cheng Chon, and António Leong, distinguished here twice with the images "Inside Out of Penha" and "The Staircase", among other photographers. In the “Student Group” category stands out the victory of Chong Man Hin. According to a CURB statement, the distinguished photographs celebrate “the inner environment built of the city”, found out of a total of 338 photographs sent by 149 participants. “The works sent were evaluated by a panel of experienced jury who selected the best photographs for this year's theme, considering its artistic and technical quality and the originality of the vision,” is referred to. This edition of the contest, the fourth, had as its theme “Inside Out”, inviting the participants “to look beyond and to enter the environment built of Macau, to discover and capture the qualities and beauty rarely seen of architecture from the inside out”. The awards ceremony will take place on Ponte 9 - Creative Platform, at Rua das Lorchas Ponte 9, 3rd floor, on August 9, at 17h00, where the distinguished works will be exhibited. The exhibition will be open to the public until August 29, Monday to Friday, from 10h to 13h and from 14h30 to 18h30. Curb also revealed that the photography contest has been going on “successfully” for four years, attracting a total of 688 participants and 1,611 registrations.

item.title: Judicial Police | Child falls from window when he was alone
item.description:
Authorities indicted the mother and maid of the crime of abandonment, punishable by prison sentence that could reach eight years. The child was alone at home, while the maid went to pick up his brother from school
The Judicial Police (PJ) indicated the mother and maid of the crime of abandonment, after a child fell from a window when he was alone at home. The case took place on July 15, but the information about the investigation was revealed on Friday by PJ, according to the newspaper or Mun. The case was discovered around 1 pm when the boy was found on the floor of Rua do Gamboa, after falling from a four -story building. The victim of the fall was taken to the hospital, where he was diagnosed with an intra-cranial hemorrhage, being hospitalized. Until yesterday, the authorities did not reveal whether the male child was at risk of life. Given the possibility of having a crime, the PJ agents investigated the fall and found that on the morning of the accident both the parents and the child's brother had left home. The child stood to keep a maid, who was also responsible for fetching the victim's older brother from school. When she fetched her brother, the maid left the boy alone at home with a tablet and locked the housing door. The minor's mother was informed about the conditions in which the child had been left. However, the PJ says it concluded that when the child was alone at home began to cry and scared. The victim also tried to use tools to open the door. However, as it could not open the door, the authorities believe that the child tried to get out of housing through the kitchen window, which led to the fall. Authorities also found that this was not the first time the boy has been home alone, which would have happened more often since June 17. The child's injuries were considered consistent with a fall in height. The case was delivered to the prosecutor and the mother and worker are indicted for the crime of abandonment, punished with a sentence of one to five years in prison, which in this case may be aggravated for eight years in prison, if it is considered that the injuries are serious offense to physical integrity. Accompanying After the investigation was made public, Hon Wai, president of the Institute of Social Action, said the family is being accompanied and that is "deeply sad", according to the Macao channel of TDM. "Unfortunately, I believe everyone knows this unfortunate incident. The family is deeply sad and IAS is providing direct assistance to the family," he said. "We need to work hard with this family, how to deal with the future and the care of children," he acknowledged. According to the or world, the president of IAS also called on families to avoid leaving children alone at home, even if it is for a short time, because there are always "risks" in these situations. Hon Wai has thus asked families to try better coordination to accompany children and involve more members in surveillance of minors.

item.title: Water | Two more brands fail security tests
item.description: The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) has announced that two waters produced outside Macau spoiled safety and quality tests. In a statement issued only in Chinese language, on Friday, AMI identified brands such as the “natural drinking water in the village of Chang Ming Shui”, originating in Zhongshan, and the Australian “PH8 Natural Alkaline Spring Water”. According to AMI, 42 water brands produced abroad from Macau for sale in local supermarkets were tested by collecting 240 samples, resulting in 48 tested products. As a result of these exams, AMI indicated that the two identified waters did not pass the tests and that the lots in question were removed from circulation. He was also appealed to residents who discharged themselves and do not consume them. In the case of the brand “Natural Drinking Water of Chang Ming Shui” village ”is at stake of an 18.9 -liter bottle of carboys, with production date of 23 May. AMI found that water has levels of coliform bacteria that do not respect the recommended standards. The coliforms are a type of bacteria, such as E.Coli, which inhabit the gut of mammals. In the case of PH8 Natural Alkaline Spring Water, tests showed levels of pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria that do not respect the recommended values. Pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria can be found in waters and soils and can lead to severe infections in the lungs, skin or urinary tract. Problem products are 1.5 liter bottles that are part of the batch identified as “B/B 09/05/26 PKD09/05/24 B.09”.

item.title: Chikungunya | New cases lead to the suspension of blood donations
item.description:
Due to imported cases of chikungunya fever, health services will ban infected, or people suspected of being infected, donating blood for six weeks
Health services announced the record of two more imported cases of chikungunya fever on Friday, which raises the number of cases for four, and announced new control measures. With the announced changes, who has been infected with chikungunya or that has symptoms of fever should suspend blood donations. The new measures were taken "taking into account the occurrence of cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever recorded in Macao and neighboring regions, and the prevention of the risk of disease transmission through blood." With the changes, there are two types of people who are unable to donate blood for six weeks: residents diagnosed with chikungunya fever and residents who were in an epidemic area two weeks before they donated blood and have symptoms such as fever, intense joint pain, headache, nausea, fatigue and stress. In the case of people with symptoms such as fever, intense joint pain or muscles, headache, nausea, fatigue and rash over the past 14 days, but have not been in epidemic zones, the blood transfusions center will make an assessment of a case-a-pellet. Summer Diseases Regarding the new cases of chikungunya fever, the first was identified in a 48-year-old non-resident worker who works on Kwong Tung Avenue and lives in Gonçalo Beco, near Avenida Almeida Ribeiro. The man was diagnosed on Friday, after being in the Philippines between July 6 and July 19, to visit the family. After returning it began to experience muscle pain and fever. He moved to Kiang Wu hospital on Thursday and was diagnosed the next day. House and work colleagues, like the family, have no symptoms of the infection. The second case was registered in a 38 -year -old resident. The man lives in Seac Pai Van, in the butterfly valley and works on one of the Cotai casinos. The man was diagnosed after being in the city of Foshan, between July 19 and 20. After returning to Macao, he had leg pain and fever. It was diagnosed on Friday at the Conde São Januário Hospital Center. Both patients are far from danger and in stable conditions. In response to the two imported cases, health services were in the zones indicated to take mosquito extermination measures. "Health services recall residents that they must be aware of prevention measures and that they must take action, so that a barrier against mosquito infectious diseases are built," he was appealed in a statement. According to health services chikungunya fever is a viral disease, transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes, especially those of Aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus.

item.title: Counterfeit | Authorities make Rusga in store
item.description: Authorities performed a Rusga at a store on Horta e Costa Avenue on Wednesday, which led to the seizure of 155 pieces of clothing and counter-suitables. The balance of the operation was done yesterday at a press conference, which was only released in Chinese language. According to the official information, cited by the newspaper or Mun, the operation fell within the Canton-Hong Kong-Macau Hong of Industrial Property cooperation mechanism. At issue is the fact that the store makes available brand clothing at affordable prices, although customs services have defined imitations as “low quality”. If they were sold at the price of the products they mimicked, the pieces of clothing and the bags would be valued at 2.39 million patacas. The case resulted in the detention of a 47-year-old, non-resident, responsible for selling products. According to customs services, at this stage authorities are still trying to investigate the identity of product suppliers as well as the store owner on Avenida Horta e Costa. The sale of products in question is an infringement of the legal regime of industrial property. For infrastors in these cases a punishment is expected to reach six months in prison or a penalty of fine from 30 to 90 days. According to the newspaper or Mun, in the presentation of the results of the Rusga, customs services have insisted that they will not save efforts to “proactively combat infringements to the legal regime of intellectual property”. However, it was also left the appeal that the owners of industrial property rights cooperate to file a complaint.

item.title: Game | Macau Sands profit fell 13% in the second quarter
item.description:
The company responsible for Casinos Venetian, Parisian and Londoner closed the second quarter with profits of $ 214 million. Despite the reduction in the face of last year, those responsible for the group underline the commitment to invest in the
Casinos operator in Macau Sands China announced yesterday's $ 214 million profits in the second quarter, a 13 percent drop over the same period of 2024. Sands China had already registered a 32 percent homologous drop in the first trimester profit. This after ending 2024 with profits of $ 1.05 billion, an increase of 50.9 percent. On the contrary, the revenues of the company's five casinos in Macau rose 2.5 percent between April and June, to $ 1.8 billion. With revenues to rise, Sands China registered operational profits of $ 566 million in the second quarter of 2025, a rise of 0.9 percent in annual terms. Robert Goldstein, the president of the Sands China mother company, the American Las Vegas Sands (LVS), pointed to the goal for the casinos in Macao operational profits between 600 and 650 million dollars per quarter. According to a statement from Sands China, Goldstein also said in an investor teleconference that the annual goal, by 2027, is operational profits of between $ 2.6 and $ 2.7 billion. According to official data, the game industry in Macau registered total revenues of 61.1 billion patacas between April and June, 8.3 percent than in the same period as 2024. Long commitment Still, Goldstein recalled that Sands China has a "commitment to a decade of making investments that increase the Macao Business and Leisure Appeal and support its development as a world tourism center." The company is one of six casino dealers who operate in the territory and whose concession agreement, valid for ten years, came into force on January 1, 2023. At the time, the six operators pledged to invest “over 100 billion patacas” in unnataged elements. Sands announced “an iconic winter garden” with 50 thousand square meters. "We are still enthusiastic about our opportunities to achieve leading industry growth in both Macao and Singapore in the coming years," Goldstein noted. Sands China made total investments of $ 286 million between April and June, including $ 138 million in Macao. Most of the money was to reshape the integrated venture Hotel-Casino Londoner Macao, a partnership with former British footballer David Beckham. The remodeling was ready in mid -April, in time for the so -called 'golden week' of May 1, a period of holidays in mainland China and a high time for tourism in Macao.

item.title: Borders | Macau behind HK in the ranking of best passports
item.description:
Macao occupies the 31st position worldwide on the list of the most powerful passports, behind Hong Kong, which is in 17th position and has more destinations without visa. Portugal occupies 4th place and China the 60th in the ranking led by Singapore
Henley & Partner's latest passport rate, titled “Henley Passport Index” places Macau in 31st place, right behind 17th Hong Kong's detained position. The two special administrative regions are, however, in better positions compared to China, which occupy the 60th place. The Macao passport allows you to travel without visa to 144 destinations, while for Hong Kong the list of countries traveling without a visa is larger, with 169. In the case of China, there are only 83 countries where national citizens can travel without visa. In a press release on the report's results, Henley & Partners points out that China leads, along with the United Arab Emirates (EAU), a "change in passport power." The consultant highlights "a general global change towards more openness, greater mobility and increased strength of passports", given that, in the last decade, "more than 80 passports have risen at least 10 positions". In addition, "the average global number of destinations to which travelers can access without visa almost doubled from 58 in 2006 to 109 by 2025". In the case of China, the climb was 34 positions, “from 94th to 60th position since 2015-which is particularly impressive, considering that, unlike other countries that have risen the ranking, China has not yet obtained access to the Schengen Space of Europe,” he stands out in the statement. The passage rate shows how “China's rise has been assisted by its significant movement towards greater opening”, given that the country “granted access without visa to more than a dozen new passports since January, raising its total opening score to 75 nations, a remarkable change considering that it allowed entry less than 20 countries for only five years”. Global analysis Henley & Partner's passport rate classifies 199 countries and regions according to the number of nationalities to which allow entry without prior visa. The data that are referenced to this ranking are from the International Air Transport Association (IATA). Still with regard to China's positioning, they refer to “the remarkable additions to China's visa exemption list this year, with nations such as Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman and Saudi Arabia. This means, for analysts, that "citizens of all Gulf Cooperation Council can travel to China without prior visa - as well as from several South American countries, including Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Peru and Uruguay." "The concession of uninstated access by China to several European countries in the last two years has also contributed to the dominance of European passports at the top of Henley Passport Power Index, which measures the percentage of GDP [Gross Domestic Product] that each passport provides its holders without visa," is mentioned. Worldwide, "Asian nations dominate the ranking of passport power," with the US and the United Kingdom to continue "declining." Singapore "holds the most powerful passport title in the world, with visaless access to 193 destinations from 227 worldwide." Asian countries continue to lead the race for global mobility, with Japan and South Korea to share second place, each granting its citizens access to 190 no visa destinations.

He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. Pinto Fernandes at the exact moment we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: Diplomacy | Thailand agrees in principle with ceasefire with Cambodia
item.description:
Thailand's interim prime minister Phumtham Wechayachai said yesterday that the country agreed, in principle, with a ceasefire, but emphasized the need for “sincere intentions” by Cambodia
According to Thai Foreign Ministry, Phumtham WeChayachai called on rapid bilateral negotiations to discuss concrete measures towards a peaceful conflict resolution. The current government leader also thanked the president of the United States, with whom he spoke hours earlier, in a telephone conversation where Donald Trump presented a ceasefire proposal. Also Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet said yesterday that the country accepted negotiations for an "immediate and unconditional ceasefire." "This is good news for soldiers and people from both countries," said Cambodian leader in a statement. Manet instructed Foreign Minister Prak Sokhonn to start discussions with US counterpart Marco Rubio to end the conflict that broke out on Thursday. Still, journalists from the France-Presse news agency in Samraong, Cambodia, about 20 kilometers from the Thailand border, heard the sound of artillery shots at dawn. A spokeswoman for the Cambodia Ministry of Defense also stated that Thailand had attacked at 4:50 am (05h50 in Macao) near two temples whose sovereignty is disputed by the two countries. Colonel Richa Suksowanont, the Thai army deputy spokesman, accused Cambodian forces of shooting yesterday morning heavy artillery against Surin's province, including civilian houses. Richa Suksowanont said Cambodia also launched rocket attacks against the former Ta Muen Thom temple, claimed by both countries, and other areas, in an attempt to recover the protected territory by Thai troops. The Thai forces responded with long-range artillery to reach the artillery and the Cambojan launches. Battlefield operations will continue and a ceasefire can only happen if Cambodia formally starts negotiations, Richa Suksowanont added. On the other side Cambodian Ministry of Defense spokesman, Lieutenant General Maly Socheata, accused Thai forces of intensifying violence with bombing in Cambodian territory on Sunday morning, followed by a “large-scale foray” involving land tanks and troops in various areas. "Such actions undermine all efforts to a peaceful resolution and expose Thailand's clear intention to intensify the conflict rather than appease it," he said. A historic border dispute between the two countries led on Thursday to clashes that involved fighters, tanks, land troops and artillery. The fighting caused 33 deaths and more than 130,000 displaced on both sides of the border. The balance already exceeds the previous series of major border clashes between the two countries, which caused 28 deaths between 2008 and 2011. The UN Security Council met in urgent and, on Saturday, the United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres, condemned the escalation of violence between Thailand and Cambodia, asked both parties who commit to a ceasefire and offered as a mediator.

item.title: Telegram | Thousands of men shared intimate photos of women
item.description: Thousands of men in China shared pictures and intimate videos of their girlfriends or wives, without their consent, in applying Telegram messages, which generated a general appeal to reinforce women's protection. The wave of reactions occurred after a Chinese student was expelled from a university in mid-July for “violation of national dignity” after an e-sport's Ukrainian player released videos on Telegram, showing that they had intimate relationships. A similar event took place on Thursday. A Chinese discovered that photos of her, taken without her knowledge, were shared in a forum of this same messaging with over 100,000 users, especially Chinese men, revealed Southern Daily, a state of state communication. “We are not content that can be discharged, viewed and randomly fantasized,” one can read in a comment on the Red Note social network. “We can no longer remain silent.” Because next time, I can be me, or be you, ”he adds. Pornography is illegal in China and conservative behaviors in relation to women remain the norm, reinforced by state media and popular culture. The largest group of this type on Telegram, called “Mask Park”, has been removed since, but smaller groups derived from this remain active, according to the woman contacted by Southern Daily. Other forum members also shared photos of their current or old companions, according to an article published in the Guangming Daily, a medium of communist communisting Chinese in power, raising a general shock on the Internet. A hashtag associated with this case has been consulted more than 230 million times on the Weibo social platform since Thursday. Chinese authorities have not yet announced any measures against Telegram, which is forbidden in China, but is still accessible through some virtual private networks, the platform told AFP news agency.

item.title: Technology | Beijing wants to reconcile artificial intelligence and its risks
item.description:
The Chinese government has called for reconciliation between the development of artificial intelligence and the risks posed by this technology, defending global consensus, despite the rivalry between Beijing and Washington on this issue
US President Donald Trump released this week an action plan to promote unrestricted development of American Artificial Intelligence (AI) models in the United States and abroad, discarding concerns about potential abuse. The US president thus breaks with the line of democratic predecessor Joe Biden, who defended controlled development. “We won't let any other nation won us” in the AI race, Trump said. On Saturday, at the opening of the World Artificial Intelligence Conference (Waic) in Shanghai, Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang appealed to good governance and resource sharing, namely the creation of an organism, launched by China, to stimulate international AI cooperation. "The risks and challenges associated with artificial intelligence are attracting wide attention ... Finding a balance between development and safety requires urgent and broader consensus of the whole of society," he said. It did not provide details about the new body, although state media reported that “the first consideration” was that the headquarters was in Shanghai (Northeast). The organization should “promote global governance, broad consultation, joint contribution and shared benefits,” said Chinese state news agency Xinhua. A Baby Tiger At a time when AI is being part of virtually all sectors, use has raised significant ethical issues ranging from disinformation to impact on employment and potential loss of technological control, France-Presse news agency said. During a speech at the Shanghai Conference, the Nobel Prize for Physics, Geoffrey Hinton, used a metaphor, 'as a baby tiger to live at home' to describe the current global situation. Hinton described the current attitude towards AI as similar to "a person adopting a cute tiger puppy as a pet." "To survive," he said, "one must be sure that one can train him so that he doesn't kill him when he grows up." The huge advances in AI technology in recent years have also placed her at the forefront of rivalry between the United States and China. China “actively encourages” the development of open source AI and is willing to share technological advances with other countries, especially developing nations, he said. "If we establish technological monopolies, controls or barriers, artificial intelligence risks becoming a privilege of a small number of countries and companies," he warned, in turn, Li Qiang. Foreign Minister Ma Zhaoxu warned, in turn, against "unilateralism and protectionism" at a subsequent meeting. The United States has intensified efforts in recent years to restrict advanced chip exports to China, with Washington to manifest concern that they can be used to modernize Chinese military and weaken the US position in technology race. The Chinese prime minister cited “the scarcity of chips and computational capacity” between a list of obstacles to the development of the sector.

item.title: North Korea | Kim calls for preparation “for war seriously”
item.description: The North Korean leader asked the country's soldiers to prepare "for a serious war," during a witnessing scout he witnessed, the Official North Korean press said yesterday. Photos released by KCNA news agency show Kim Jong-un, dressed in a black fact, heading to uniform soldiers. Other images show Kim to carefully observe an artillery shooting exercise alongside several North Korean military leaders. The shooting session took place on Wednesday, in an unveiled place. Images released by the agency also showed projectiles to be fired towards the sea. During the visit, Kim spoke to the North Korean soldiers, whom they asked to prepare “for a serious war” and to be able to “destroy the enemy in all battles,” according to KCNA. This visit happens after a North Korean contingent participated in combat against the Ukrainian forces in the Russian region of Kursk, partially occupied by Kiev troops since the summer of 2024 and that Russia announced that it had fully resumed in late April.

item.title: Thailand | Nine dead and 14 injured by Cambojan air strikes
item.description:
Cambojan air strikes killed nine people, including an eight -year -old, and wounded 14, the Thai army said yesterday, the day the conflict between the two countries intensified
Nine people died and 14 were injured in Thailand following the Cambodian air strike offensive. According to the Thai army, one of the deadly victims was a 14 -year -old child. Thailand said it had launched air strikes against two military targets in Cambodia, while Cambodian soldiers fired several rockets against Thai territory. Six people were killed in attacks near a fuel supply post in Sisaket (Northeast), two in the province of Surin (Northeast) and one in the province of Ubon Ratchathani (Northeast). Thai authorities announced the full closure of all terrestrial border passages with Cambodia, after clashes between the two armies in various areas that separate these neighboring countries. The level of security in the border passages was high for the 4-the maximum-which constitutes a complete closure, said at a press conference the spokesman for the Thai center that monitors the situation on the border with Cambodia, Admiral Surasant KongSiri. "Given the current situation, it is necessary for Thailand to close the barriers on border passages to protect our sovereignty, territorial integrity and the safety of people in border areas," said the center of the Center, Maratee Nalita at the same time. Coveted land Since late June, Thailand has implemented access restrictions on all border posts over the more than 800 kilometers of border that shares with Cambodia, allowing entry only for humanitarian reasons, health or education. The total closure comes after yesterday's clashes between Thai and Cambodian armies in a border zone disputed, according to both sides, who mutually accuse themselves to start the conflict after weeks of tension. However, Cambodia Prime Minister Hun Manet yesterday requested an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council. "Considering the recent extremely serious aggressions of Thailand, which have severely threatened peace and stability in the region, I sincerely ask you to call an emergency meeting of the Security Council to end Thailand's aggression," Hun Manet wrote in a letter to the President of Security Council, Asim Iftikhar Ahmad. The longstanding conflict between the two countries rekindled on May 28, after a confrontation between the two armies around an unrestricted border zone claimed by the two nations, which resulted in the death of a Cambodian soldier. The Thailand Embassy in Cambodia yesterday asked Thai citizens to abandon the neighboring country, after the confrontations and given the possibility of the attacks "continuing and spreading." Territorial tension has been usually approached diplomatically, although between 2008 and 2011, about 30 people died in military clashes between the two countries in a territory adjacent to the Hindu Temple of Preah Vihear.

item.title: China-UE | Commitment to reinforce efforts against climate change
item.description: China and the European Union (EU) pledged yesterday to reinforce joint efforts to combat climate change, according to a statement released under the 25th Bilateral Summit, held in Beijing. "Global warming is traditionally an area of convergence between Brussels and Beijing," says the text, stressing the intention to accelerate "fast, large -scale and all levels" climate action. The EU intends to achieve carbonic neutrality by 2050, while China, the world's largest broadcaster of greenhouse gases, has committed to this goal by 2060. Despite bilateral tensions, both parties agreed to reinforce cooperation in areas such as energy transition, climate change adaptation, methane emissions control, carbon markets and green and low carbon technologies. The statement also appeals to the global enlargement of renewable energy and facilitating access to ecological technologies, a sector in which China is the world leader, including electric vehicles and solar panels. According to David Waskow of the World Resource Institute (WRI) Reflection Center, this statement sends "an important sign that climate cooperation can overcome geopolitical tensions." Yao Zhe, representative of the Greenpeace Environmental Organization, warns that "it is now necessary to go to practice."

item.title: MONGOLIA INTERNAL | Six students die on visiting the mine
item.description: Six college students died after falling into a flotation tank during an academic visit to a mineral processing unit in the Chinese Autonomous region of Mongolia Interior, local authorities said yesterday. The accident occurred on Wednesday, around 10:20 am, when a metallic grid gave in the weight of the group, causing the students to fall into a tank with industrial lamas, at the copper concentration plant and molybdenium of Wunugetushan, operated by Inner Mongolia Mining, subsidiary of the China National Group National Gold. Despite rescue operations, the six students - all in the third year of the University of Northeast in Shenyang - were declared dead at the scene. A teacher accompanying the visit was injured, according to local authorities. "Preliminary investigations indicate that the grid broke during the visit, causing the accidental fall," said one official quoted by the portal Jimu News. The dimensions of the tank were not disclosed. The reservoir contained a thick mixture of water, ground minerals and chemical reagents that, according to experts heard by the Chinese press, makes survival "practically impossible." The accident occurred only ten days after the company held a meeting on labor security, according to a July 16 publication on its official account on the Wechat platform, where it highlighted “rigorous” protocols and the goal of “zero accidents” to 2024. The plant is considered one of the first in China to operate with large capacity flotation systems, according to a technical article published in 2011.

item.title: António Costa asks China to use influence to end the war in Ukraine
item.description: European Council President Antonio Costa yesterday defended a more balanced relationship with China and asked Beijing to use his influence to end the war in Ukraine, in a summit marked by commercial tensions. In a meeting with Chinese Prime Minister, Li Qiang, part of the 25th Bilateral Summit between the European Union (EU) and China, Costa said that after 50 years on the establishment of diplomatic relations, economic and human ties between both parties “grew exponentially, bringing prosperity to both sides”. "As heavy business partners, our economies and societies have become closely interconnected. EU and China also cooperate in the advancement of the multilateral environmental agenda," he said. "We want to work to ensure that our economic relationship is balanced, reciprocal and mutually beneficial. Trade between EU and China has become growing asymmetrical and this is not sustainable," Costa warned, alongside European Commission President Ursula Von Der Leyen. According to Chinese data, China's exports to the EU grew 7 percent in the first half of the year, while imports from the European bloc fell 6 percent, aggravating the European commercial deficit, which currently exceeds 300 billion euros. Conciliatory António Costa also reinforced the EU concerns about Chinese support to Russia, appealing to Li Qiang so that, as a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council, use his influence to end the war in Ukraine. "We have a common interest in maintaining constructive and stable relations. But for that it is necessary that China plays an active role for peace and international stability," he said. China has avoided condemning the Russian invasion and is accused by Brussels and Washington of indirectly supporting Moscow with exports of dual and military goods. On the eve of the summit, Beijing criticized European sanctions against two Chinese banks for alleged trade links with Russia. Despite the disagreements, Costa stressed that the EU is “committed to deepening bilateral partnership and working with good faith and honesty to face global challenges”, on a basis of mutual respect, reciprocity, and commitment to international rules.

item.title: European Union | XI Jinping calls for strategic renewal of relations
item.description:
Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday appealed to a strategic renewal in relations with the European Union during a summit in Beijing marked by growing commercial, technological and geopolitical tensions between the two blocks
The meeting with the president of the European Commission, Ursula Von der Leyen, and the president of the European Council, António Costa, took place at the Great Palace of the People, as part of the 25th China-UE Summit, which marks the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Brussels and Beijing. According to XI, over the last five decades, the bell ties have produced “fruit results” and benefited both parties and the world. The Chinese leader argued that, in the face of “a more challenging and complex international situation,” China and EU should reinforce communication, foster confidence and deepen cooperation, contributing more stability and predictability to the world. "We should seek convergences, even maintaining disagreements, and persist in the opening and mutual benefit," he said, stressing the importance of promoting a bilateral relationship "that continues to grow in the right direction" and that can project for the next 50 years "even brighter". Despite the diplomatic rhetoric, European analysts and sources warned that the summit occurs in a climate of mutual distrust and limited expectations of concrete results. The reflection group (‘Think Tank’) Bruegel classified the meeting as a “non-set” due to the persistent impasse in the main areas of discord. Among the central themes are commercial imbalance-with a European deficit of over 300 billion euros-and access to critical raw materials, such as rare lands, subject to export restrictions from China. The EU accuses Beijing to distort markets by strongly subsidizing its industry, especially in the sector of electric vehicles, whose exports at prices below those practiced by European manufacturers led Brussels to impose additional rates between 17 and 45.3 percent. OTHER FOCOS Another focus of tension lies in Chinese support to Russia. In June, von der Leyen accused Beijing of feeding the Russian war economy with “unconditional” support to Moscow. According to South China Morning Post, Hong Kong newspaper, Chinese diplomacy chief Wang Yi will have warned European interlocutors that a possible Russian collapse would divert the strategic focus of the United States to Indo-Pacific-something China intends to avoid. European diplomats cited by the political magazine also accuse Beijing of trying to divide the community bloc, favoring bilateral relations with countries such as Germany or France, to the detriment of a unified approach. The publication The Diplomat notes that the symbolism of the 50th anniversary contrasts with the current reality: "The summit should only confirm how far the values and interests of both parties are."

item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

How? He lived a series of disagreements, of extreme experiences. Suffice it to say that you have been stuck several times and for various reasons. He made great trips at a time when these were absolutely risky, long, and complicated enterprises. Camões was involved in military expeditions, and almost all his life was soldered. But this set of experiences allowed him to be almost everything someone could be at the time he lived. He was one of the most traveled authors of the time, having been in Brazil, Goa… Yes. Can we talk about a period of stability in Camões's life in Macau? Yes. Until this appointment as a deceased provider, everything Camões knew from the East had been as a soldier. Although everyone said that the soldiers lived very poorly, the welding was what Camões had to survive. The time lived in Macao, when he was free from soldier obligations, was a time of tranquility regarding subsistence, which was assured. item.title: Filipe de Saavedra, Teacher: “A Camões Interpretative Center in Macau is missing”
item.description:
Professor at the University of Science and Technology of Macao and a scholar of the presence of Camões in Asia, Philip de Saavedra understands that Macau is missing an interpretative center about the poet's life and work. The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia
He participated yesterday at the “from Lisbon to Goa: What the Letters of Camões” participated. What path does the East arise portrayed in these letters, and who were directed? The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature. Some were written from Ternate, others from Malaca, Macau, probably others from Cambodia, to recipients in India and Portugal. With the exception of the letters of Goa, where the identification of the writing site is generally present, mapping those that were written during the remainder of his Asian designer would be a complex task. They are only given as written in Asia. Can you give examples of written letters in this context? I mention here two of the first he sent to the kingdom. The epistle whose first line is “The Poet Simony speaking” was written in January 1554, when Camões has just arrived in Goa, destined for his pupil, D. António de Noronha. It is a very emotional letter, giving it the storm that had plagued the Armada in the Cape of Good Hope, "seeing the death of the before me." Camões survived this limit experience aboard the São Bento ship, the only one to arrive that year to Goa, and which was lost in the turn of the Christmas lands, dying in this second bid the Captain Fernão de Álvares Cabral, and many of those who traveled with him. In addition to the news of his salvation, the poet was equally eager to tell his friend the expedition of D. Afonso de Noronha to Malabar, in which he had taken part in the previous month. In Irenal pages, Camões vehemently condemns the massacre of the few native troops by the “thick armed” of the disproportionate vice-king army. In his radical compliment of peace, the poet calls "true remedy" to the early death that cure the war crazes of those who want to live "by knights", for "who will walk by following the fero Mars always brings their eyes to their danger." Cruelly prophetic words: by irony of fate, at the moment the poet wrote these lines and sent them, that recipient diletus, for whose life he feared, already lay, lying during a military foray in Ceuta on April 29, 1553, only 17 years old. And the second letter? A year later, in January 1555, he wrote to a friend a different epistle in tone and in purpose, whose first line is "I wished so much", where he evoked the shock he suffered from the death of D. António, gathering a sonnet that had composed to his memory. It is clear that Camões also had great intimacy with this correspondent, who knew D. The landing of Camões in Patane's busty, then called “cave”, is surrounded by a beautiful legendary aura. The joke ran a swimming, and little by little it was embedded in the collective imagination, to the point that some less informed people take it for a supposed “discovery” recent. However, nonsense was released in 1907, and soon dismantled in 1911 by Jordan de Freitas. Judge Eduardo Ribeiro put more “points in the iis” in this regard. In your time I will publish the full documentation about the presence of Camões in Macao, putting a definitive end to the mythical “myth”. What life did Camões in Macau? We can say that these two years were those of the greatest professional, economic and affective in his life. Is it written poetry? Constantly, as the dimension of the work attests. A significant part of “the Lusíadas” was composed here, although the poem had neither began nor ended in Macao. Not least in his life was that it was in Macao who publicly assumed a relationship with a young Chinese, most exactly the Tanka ethnicity of poor fishermen. This asymmetrical connection is not surprising and with a modest young woman: only disadvantaged families would not prevent daughters from relate to foreigners. This explains the fact that she left with Camões in 1565 to Goa, with concubine status. It was only after his death that he would come to chrisma as Denamene, a Greek nymph of the waters, so that she could live forever in the ocean. The Chinese of Macao have a special relationship with Camões, such as the Portuguese and the Macanese. How is this relationship? The Viscount of Juromenha says that in 1845 the Viceroy of Canton and Imperial Commissioner Ki-A there was worshiped Camões as the “Portuguese Confucius”. And rightly, Camões shares many aspects of the sages of Chinese tradition: he established a dialogue with the masters through the recreation of larger works, cultivated a millennial tradition (he gloss two thousand years prior to his own time), practiced itinerary as a source of "sagesse", said the primacy of poetry, conceived the rivers as mythical entities, even personifying them, even personifying them, even He showed a marked tendency to moralize, and epitomously his thinking in masterful sentences. What connection did Camões have with Goa? Unlike Macao, Goa raised in Camões mostly negative feelings. What is going on for Gypsy communities to remain “on the fringes” of the so -called society? The model of society remains to be changed. This is extremely stratified by placing people in subordinate places to privilege a violent minority. The white social structure is patriarchal and racist. What is called the "margin" of society is actually an intrinsic place to it, which belongs to it. In other words, Gypsy people have been included in this model of society since they discovered Europe and its kingdoms. The problem is the model of society that is maintained and the place to which they were relegated and how they were relegated: with violence, in inferior status against whites, without the right to human dignity, to constitute a family, to choose one's own language and religion, expropriated from any and all cultural and material law. The model we live in leads to the Gypsy (and not only) community to economic exclusion, removing it from access to product consumption or excluding them from its production process; political exclusion associated with lack of access to information; To education and consequently the social exclusion that is seen in inequality of access to quality community areas such as restaurants, libraries, theater, cinema, concerts, health care, etc. How do you feel a gypsy child when you realize that it is not part of a whole? Children who are never represented, neither in movies, nor in books, nor in cartoons, not even in an announcement to eat cereals, for example? Is this a disaster for self-esteem, is a priori condemnation? The question is that. Gypsy people are not “excluded from society”, by contrast, they are included in it. The problem is the existence of what is cynically called 'social exclusion', which term Orwellian, and there be under coercion, people. Which field of concentration and extermination. Incidentally, Nazi concentration camps are a more visual realization than called 'social exclusion' and, as here, were not a 'excluded' part of Nazi society, but rather its fundamental and characterizing structure. It is a place of violence, where people are maintained by violence, dedicated to their extermination, and designed so that few people can leave. And yet they resist. As in Nazi concentration camps. And what you have listed as an example of 'consequence' of this 'exclusion', is actually the means by which this exclusion also happens and remains. Gypsy people are out of theaters, both as consumers and producers (but go to the cinema). They are out of school, education and the gym. Either as 'users' or as producers (but go to school and are on the basis of knowledge construction and academic and scientific debates). Even in attacking Gypsy children's self -confidence, we talk about a maintenance mechanism of this situation. But Gypsy people respond very well: with Gypsy pride. Another resistance, another aggression. Gypsy people are thus included in society. In a place that belongs to this model of modern society. And they resist and contradict the power of domination and make a point of being in the city, in the cinema, in the theater, in the gym, in all spaces. With a lot of struggle and always resisting, but they are there. Social exclusion, more than a “place outside of society”, is part of its social structure. Do you want to say that there is a collective resistance? At work, already in a context of absolute precariousness, during the pandemic, Gypsy people rolled up sleeves and showed once again proactivity and creativity in adversity. They learned seeing and doing. And here, it is again the women who jump to the front line, face, learn to use digital tools with their daughters or children, and throw themselves into the network. And so they explore online sales as well as application by application (transportation or rehabs). In housing, in a context of pandemic in which the evictions were not locked - as they owed and dictated the law itself - residents did not fail to organize and fight unjust evictions and claim dignity in housing; associations of allied residents in their action with other housing and anti-racist struggle organizations. It should also be noted how they reinvented and intensified to raise and distribute dietary goods and kits of masks/alcohol gel to the most expropriated people. Gypsies and non -Gypsies. In the anti-racist struggle, new movements emerged and their actions intensified by social networks. People who had never been organized or militated before began their first steps in activism, thickening this way of the organization and popular gypsy and anti-racist action. People forget, or do not want to value, but Gypsy action has helped determine results in the political dispute. Gypsy citizens mobilized in large and determined electoral results in the municipalities of 2017, both in Alentejo and in the Lisbon Metropolitan Area, even causing electoral earthquakes. And even in the presidential, second place was resolved by a value equivalent to the estimated number of Gypsy voters. Apart from the non -Gypsy votes that were mobilized by the action of Gypsy voters. Gypsy people are even co-considering power in the spaces of opinion, local media, social networks and party and institutional political dispute. And most importantly, in the popular Ação and alliances with other social movements. We have never stopped fighting for all means and continuing to resist. In contrast there are more and more hate speeches, from the far right in particular. What do you have to say about it? To start these speeches are historical and European. Not even current and even less “of the far right”. These speeches have been adopted and rendered for a long time, even in 'democracy and freedom', by several representatives of the center right, conservatives, left center, liberal, liberal left, even representatives of the PCP. Anti-egana rhetoric has always worked in Portugal as it is the whiter rhetoric [white genesis]. That is, it allows you to create and give the "white" as the superior of all. And so please the white electorate who, when feeling well, pays off with his vote. Even if the policies implemented by their elected harm him even more. Finally, did you like them to talk a little about your personal experience and how did you get to the activist? I studied, fought for studies, made alliances, graduated, went in the labor market of the “formal precariousness”. I started my militant action and here I am today. We can transform this society a better. This certainty combined with the fact that the current one has so much suffering makes anyone want to have a transformist attitude. I wanted to be 'inventor' (physical engineer) and anti -racist militant. And through study (not necessarily schooling) and organization with others, in turn, with other studies, formations and visions, I learned how the world works and how it can be changed. But before transforming, we need to survive. Hence two types of actions arise: transformative and survival. The struggle against hate discourse arises as survival, but his defeat will be a transformative victory. There is a lot that - like people who want a better world - we have to do, namely working to criminalize hate speech; condemn and prohibit organizations with racist discourses and practices; denounce the racist institutional structure and logics that organize power and generate community resources. And in this sense, there have been various types of actions, of petitions, to manifestations. And we need more. I, besides being a military man in the SOS Racism movement, participate in the “We came to stay” podcast, with Mamadou BA and Joseph da Silva. And if all goes well, we will soon start a new project. With friendly people, we also have the project “Gypsy Initiative”, dedicated to reflecting and promoting transformative movements. Essentially focused on educating against anti-agigarism, denouncing historical and continued genocide and working for a new society project. Also with new projects on the gutter. And finally, there are always voluntary actions without an organization, where I try to share what I found out about anti-egism and Roman history in schools and with interested people. In addition, there is still the struggle for housing, because the evictions did not stop during the pandemic. Due to housing and work precariousness, the subjects racialized especially the Roma nationals are the most vulnerable to COVID-19. There is essential to have actions in this area; Of all the struggles, this is the most structural, as it goes against one of the main enemies of a healthy society: the real estate speculation of this capitalist system, which places profit and goods above people and their humanization.

item.title: Great Bay Race learned more pilots for the GP
item.description: The GT Cup Races - Great Bay Race, integrated at the 72nd edition of the Macao Grand Prix, ended with a double journey at the Pingtan Speed Festival last weekend of June. Of the twenty -eight vacancies assigned by the first two GT Cup races, only one Macao pilot got a direct entrance at the great sports event of November. Following the success of the two races played under the China Formula 1 Grand Prix, both 30 -minute races of the GT4 Chinese Championship had a total of 21 participants at the event held at the International Circuit of Lago Ruyi in Pingtan. This picturesque track, located in Fujian province, replaced the Zhuhai International Circuit, initially included in the provisional calendar released in January, but did not confirm the holding of his event. In Pingtan's semiurban layout, Chinese pilot Han Lichao won both races behind his Toyota GR Supra GT4 EVO2. In two very lively races, Kevin Leong Ian Veng (BMW M4 GT4) was the only Macau pilot scoring, having reached a sixth and eighth place, respectively. Although only one Pilot of the Misrem has guaranteed the direct determination, it is possible that more riders in the territory will align on the GT - Great Bay Race, integrated in the Macao Grand Prix. This is because only 21 pilots scored in these four races, which means that even if all these pilots are signed up for the guide circuit race, seven vacancies will still be filled. In addition to Kevin Leong, seven other pilots from Macau - Miguel Law, Wong Cheng Tou, Fok Wai Ming, Lao Kim Hou, IP Un Hous, Wong Wai Hong and Law Kit Meng - participated in at least one of the two qualification events and may be repaired for local test if the sports committee's sports committee of the Macau Grand Prix so. Among the riders are some known names of the region's motorsport, such as Darryl O'Young, double winner of the Macau GT Cup; Chen Weian, 12 -hour separate winner; Liu Kaishun, Chinese F4 runner-up; Daniel Lu, former Champion of the Porsche Carrera Asia Cup; or Luo Kailuo, winner of the GT Cup - Great Bay Race at Macao's 70th Grand Prix. It's not over yet This debut season, Sro GT Cup still has two more pointed events, the last, naturally, played in the iconic Guide Circuit. The competition, which has the support of the Macao General Automobile Association - China (AAMC), has reached its intermediate point, and the struggle for the title is in the red. Prior to the mandatory visit to Macau, from 17 to 19 October, the GT4 category cars will compete at the first event held on the streets of Yizhuang, in Beijing. Beijing's Citadino Circuit is one of the most anticipated auto events in the Popular Republic of China and represents an excellent opportunity for Macao GT4 riders - and not only to prepare for the big challenge that are the curves and counterclaces of the territory layout.

item.title: TCR China | André Couto participated in the Zhejiang race
item.description: Over the weekend, André Couto had an unexpected return to the TCR China Championship, in what was his first race of this season. The rider of the sgas showed that "who knows, never forgets", despite having had a troubled passage through the Zhejiang International Circuit The Portuguese pilot residing in Macao, who has not competed since November last year-when he played the World Lamborghini Super Trofeo World Finals, having won the title in the Pro-AM category of Lamborghini Super Trofeo Asia-received a last-minute invitation from MacPro Racing Team to conduct one of the Honda Civic Fl5 TCR Territory in the third race of the Chinese championship TCR. Without any prior training, André Couto came back to sit in a car he already knew, also with a technical structure that was familiar to him. By 2023, the territory pilot had already played some TCR China events with this set, then at the service of the official team Dongfeng Honda Racing Team, showing a progress right from the beginning. "Free training did not go wrong, but in qualification a less attentive pilot hit me on my first departure lap to the track. He hit me from behind and did not realize why. In Q2, due to the damage, the Japanese car “became much harder to guide” and Couto ended in tenth. However, this ended up having a positive effect: “With the reversal of the starting grid, the tenth place of Q2 allowed me to start first to the second race.” The first race, played on Saturday on the shaoxing track, did not go as well as the pilot wanted, not being able to follow the official links, nor the best Honda and Hyundai.
